    8637           0 :                 constrs[j].conindex = 0;
    8638           0 :                 constrs[j].condeferrable = false;
    8639           0 :                 constrs[j].condeferred = false;
    8640           0 :                 constrs[j].conislocal = (PQgetvalue(res, j, 4)[0] == 't');
    8641             : 
    8642             :                 /*
    8643             :                  * An unvalidated constraint needs to be dumped separately, so
    8644             :                  * that potentially-violating existing data is loaded before
    8645             :                  * the constraint.
    8646             :                  */
    8647           0 :                 constrs[j].separate = !validated;
    8648             : 
    8649           0 :                 constrs[j].dobj.dump = tbinfo->dobj.dump;
    8650             : 
    8651             :                 /*
    8652             :                  * Mark the constraint as needing to appear before the table
    8653             :                  * --- this is so that any other dependencies of the
    8654             :                  * constraint will be emitted before we try to create the
    8655             :                  * table.  If the constraint is to be dumped separately, it
    8656             :                  * will be dumped after data is loaded anyway, so don't do it.
    8657             :                  * (There's an automatic dependency in the opposite direction
    8658             :                  * anyway, so don't need to add one manually here.)
    8659             :                  */
    8660           0 :                 if (!constrs[j].separate)
    8661           0 :                     addObjectDependency(&tbinfo->dobj,
    8662           0 :                                         constrs[j].dobj.dumpId);
    8663             : 
    8664             :                 /*
    8665             :                  * If the constraint is inherited, this will be detected later
    8666             :                  * (in pre-8.4 databases).  We also detect later if the
    8667             :                  * constraint must be split out from the table definition.
    8668             :                  */
    8669             :             }
    8670           0 :             PQclear(res);
    8671             :         }
    8672             :     }
    8673             : 
    8674           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(q);
    8675           0 : }
    8676             : 
    8677             : /*
    8678             :  * Test whether a column should be printed as part of table's CREATE TABLE.
    8679             :  * Column number is zero-based.
    8680             :  *
    8681             :  * Normally this is always true, but it's false for dropped columns, as well
    8682             :  * as those that were inherited without any local definition.  (If we print
    8683             :  * such a column it will mistakenly get pg_attribute.attislocal set to true.)
    8684             :  * For partitions, it's always true, because we want the partitions to be
    8685             :  * created independently and ATTACH PARTITION used afterwards.
    8686             :  *
    8687             :  * In binary_upgrade mode, we must print all columns and fix the attislocal/
    8688             :  * attisdropped state later, so as to keep control of the physical column
    8689             :  * order.
    8690             :  *
    8691             :  * This function exists because there are scattered nonobvious places that
    8692             :  * must be kept in sync with this decision.
    8693             :  */
    8694             : bool
    8695           0 : shouldPrintColumn(DumpOptions *dopt, TableInfo *tbinfo, int colno)
    8696             : {
    8697           0 :     if (dopt->binary_upgrade)
    8698           0 :         return true;
    8699           0 :     if (tbinfo->attisdropped[colno])
    8700           0 :         return false;
    8701           0 :     return (tbinfo->attislocal[colno] || tbinfo->ispartition);
    8702             : }
    8703             : 
    8704             :

    9462           0 :         daclinfo[i].defaclobjtype = *(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_defaclobjtype));
    9463           0 :         daclinfo[i].defaclacl = pg_strdup(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_defaclacl));
    9464           0 :         daclinfo[i].rdefaclacl = pg_strdup(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_rdefaclacl));
    9465           0 :         daclinfo[i].initdefaclacl = pg_strdup(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_initdefaclacl));
    9466           0 :         daclinfo[i].initrdefaclacl = pg_strdup(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_initrdefaclacl));
    9467             : 
    9468             :         /* Decide whether we want to dump it */
    9469           0 :         selectDumpableDefaultACL(&(daclinfo[i]), dopt);
    9470             :     }
    9471             : 
    9472           0 :     PQclear(res);
    9473             : 
    9474           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
    9475             : 
    9476           0 :     return daclinfo;
    9477             : }
    9478             : 
    9479             : /*
    9480             :  * dumpComment --
    9481             :  *
    9482             :  * This routine is used to dump any comments associated with the
    9483             :  * object handed to this routine. The routine takes the object type
    9484             :  * and object name (ready to print, except for schema decoration), plus
    9485             :  * the namespace and owner of the object (for labeling the ArchiveEntry),
    9486             :  * plus catalog ID and subid which are the lookup key for pg_description,
    9487             :  * plus the dump ID for the object (for setting a dependency).
    9488             :  * If a matching pg_description entry is found, it is dumped.
    9489             :  *
    9490             :  * Note: in some cases, such as comments for triggers and rules, the "type"
    9491             :  * string really looks like, e.g., "TRIGGER name ON".  This is a bit of a hack
    9492             :  * but it doesn't seem worth complicating the API for all callers to make
    9493             :  * it cleaner.
    9494             :  *
    9495             :  * Note: although this routine takes a dumpId for dependency purposes,
    9496             :  * that purpose is just to mark the dependency in the emitted dump file
    9497             :  * for possible future use by pg_restore.  We do NOT use it for determining
    9498             :  * ordering of the comment in the dump file, because this routine is called
    9499             :  * after dependency sorting occurs.  This routine should be called just after
    9500             :  * calling ArchiveEntry() for the specified object.
    9501             :  */
    9502             : static void
    9503           0 : dumpComment(Archive *fout, const char *type, const char *name,
    9504             :             const char *namespace, const char *owner,
    9505             :             CatalogId catalogId, int subid, DumpId dumpId)
    9506             : {
    9507           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
    9508             :     CommentItem *comments;
    9509             :     int         ncomments;
    9510             : 
    9511             :     /* do nothing, if --no-comments is supplied */
    9512           0 :     if (dopt->no_comments)
    9513           0 :         return;
    9514             : 
    9515             :     /* Comments are schema not data ... except blob comments are data */
    9516           0 :     if (strcmp(type, "LARGE OBJECT") != 0)
    9517             :     {
    9518           0 :         if (dopt->dataOnly)
    9519           0 :             return;
    9520             :     }
    9521             :     else
    9522             :     {
    9523             :         /* We do dump blob comments in binary-upgrade mode */
    9524           0 :         if (dopt->schemaOnly && !dopt->binary_upgrade)
    9525           0 :             return;
    9526             :     }
    9527             : 
    9528             :     /* Search for comments associated with catalogId, using table */
    9529           0 :     ncomments = findComments(fout, catalogId.tableoid, catalogId.oid,
    9530             :                              &comments);
    9531             : 
    9532             :     /* Is there one matching the subid? */
    9533           0 :     while (ncomments > 0)
    9534             :     {
    9535           0 :         if (comments->objsubid == subid)
    9536           0 :             break;
    9537           0 :         comments++;
    9538           0 :         ncomments--;
    9539             :     }
    9540             : 
    9541             :     /* If a comment exists, build COMMENT ON statement */
    9542           0 :     if (ncomments > 0)
    9543             :     {
    9544           0 :         PQExpBuffer query = createPQExpBuffer();
    9545           0 :         PQExpBuffer tag = createPQExpBuffer();
    9546             : 
    9547           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "COMMENT ON %s ", type);
    9548           0 :         if (namespace && *namespace)
    9549           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(query, "%s.", fmtId(namespace));
    9550           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "%s IS ", name);
    9551           0 :         appendStringLiteralAH(query, comments->descr, fout);
    9552           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(query, ";\n");
    9553             : 
    9554           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(tag, "%s %s", type, name);
    9555             : 
    9556             :         /*
    9557             :          * We mark comments as SECTION_NONE because they really belong in the
    9558             :          * same section as their parent, whether that is pre-data or
    9559             :          * post-data.
    9560             :          */
    9561           0 :         ArchiveEntry(fout, nilCatalogId, createDumpId(),
    9562           0 :                      ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = tag->data,
    9563             :                                   .namespace = namespace,
    9564             :                                   .owner = owner,
    9565             :                                   .description = "COMMENT",
    9566             :                                   .section = SECTION_NONE,
    9567             :                                   .createStmt = query->data,
    9568             :                                   .deps = &dumpId,
    9569             :                                   .nDeps = 1));
    9570             : 
    9571           0 :         destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
    9572           0 :         destroyPQExpBuffer(tag);
    9573             :     }
    9574             : }
    9575             : 
    9576             : /*
    9577             :  * dumpTableComment --
    9578             :  *
    9579             :  * As above, but dump comments for both the specified table (or view)
    9580             :  * and its columns.
    9581             :  */
    9582             : static void
    9583           0 : dumpTableComment(Archive *fout, TableInfo *tbinfo,
    9584             :                  const char *reltypename)
    9585             : {
    9586           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
    9587             :     CommentItem *comments;
    9588             :     int         ncomments;
    9589             :     PQExpBuffer query;
    9590             :     PQExpBuffer tag;
    9591             : 
    9592             :     /* do nothing, if --no-comments is supplied */
    9593           0 :     if (dopt->no_comments)
    9594           0 :         return;
    9595             : 
    9596             :     /* Comments are SCHEMA not data */
    9597           0 :     if (dopt->dataOnly)
    9598           0 :         return;
    9599             : 
    9600             :     /* Search for comments associated with relation, using table */
    9601           0 :     ncomments = findComments(fout,
    9602             :                              tbinfo->dobj.catId.tableoid,
    9603             :                              tbinfo->dobj.catId.oid,
    9604             :                              &comments);
    9605             : 
    9606             :     /* If comments exist, build COMMENT ON statements */
    9607           0 :     if (ncomments <= 0)
    9608           0 :         return;
    9609             : 
    9610           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
    9611           0 :     tag = createPQExpBuffer();
    9612             : 
    9613           0 :     while (ncomments > 0)
    9614             :     {
    9615           0 :         const char *descr = comments->descr;
    9616           0 :         int         objsubid = comments->objsubid;
    9617             : 
    9618           0 :         if (objsubid == 0)
    9619             :         {
    9620           0 :             resetPQExpBuffer(tag);
    9621           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(tag, "%s %s", reltypename,
    9622           0 :                               fmtId(tbinfo->dobj.name));
    9623             : 
    9624           0 :             resetPQExpBuffer(query);
    9625           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(query, "COMMENT ON %s %s IS ", reltypename,
    9626           0 :                               fmtQualifiedDumpable(tbinfo));
    9627           0 :             appendStringLiteralAH(query, descr, fout);
    9628           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(query, ";\n");

    9631           0 :                          ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = tag->data,

    9637             :                                       .deps = &(tbinfo->dobj.dumpId),
    9638             :                                       .nDeps = 1));
    9639             :         }
    9640           0 :         else if (objsubid > 0 && objsubid <= tbinfo->numatts)
    9641             :         {
    9642           0 :             resetPQExpBuffer(tag);
    9643           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(tag, "COLUMN %s.",
    9644           0 :                               fmtId(tbinfo->dobj.name));
    9645           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(tag, fmtId(tbinfo->attnames[objsubid - 1]));

    9651           0 :                               fmtId(tbinfo->attnames[objsubid - 1]));
    9652           0 :             appendStringLiteralAH(query, descr, fout);
    9653           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(query, ";\n");
    9654             : 
    9655           0 :             ArchiveEntry(fout, nilCatalogId, createDumpId(),
    9656           0 :                          ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = tag->data,
    9657             :                                       .namespace = tbinfo->dobj.namespace->dobj.name,
    9658             :                                       .owner = tbinfo->rolname,
    9659             :                                       .description = "COMMENT",
    9660             :                                       .section = SECTION_NONE,
    9661             :                                       .createStmt = query->data,
    9662             :                                       .deps = &(tbinfo->dobj.dumpId),
    9663             :                                       .nDeps = 1));
    9664             :         }
    9665             : 
    9666           0 :         comments++;
    9667           0 :         ncomments--;

    9669             : 
    9670           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
    9671           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(tag);
    9672             : }
    9673             : 
    9674             : /*
    9675             :  * findComments --
    9676             :  *
    9677             :  * Find the comment(s), if any, associated with the given object.  All the
    9678             :  * objsubid values associated with the given classoid/objoid are found with
    9679             :  * one search.
    9680             :  */
    9681             : static int
    9682           0 : findComments(Archive *fout, Oid classoid, Oid objoid,
    9683             :              CommentItem **items)
    9684             : {
    9685             :     /* static storage for table of comments */
    9686             :     static CommentItem *comments = NULL;
    9687             :     static int  ncomments = -1;
    9688             : 
    9689           0 :     CommentItem *middle = NULL;
    9690             :     CommentItem *low;
    9691             :     CommentItem *high;
    9692             :     int         nmatch;
    9693             : 
    9694             :     /* Get comments if we didn't already */
    9695           0 :     if (ncomments < 0)
    9696           0 :         ncomments = collectComments(fout, &comments);
    9697             : 
    9698             :     /*
    9699             :      * Do binary search to find some item matching the object.
    9700             :      */
    9701           0 :     low = &comments[0];
    9702           0 :     high = &comments[ncomments - 1];
    9703           0 :     while (low <= high)
    9704             :     {
    9705           0 :         middle = low + (high - low) / 2;
    9706             : 
    9707           0 :         if (classoid < middle->classoid)
    9708           0 :             high = middle - 1;
    9709           0 :         else if (classoid > middle->classoid)
    9710           0 :             low = middle + 1;
    9711           0 :         else if (objoid < middle->objoid)
    9712           0 :             high = middle - 1;
    9713           0 :         else if (objoid > middle->objoid)
    9714           0 :             low = middle + 1;
    9715             :         else
    9716           0 :             break;              /* found a match */
    9717             :     }
    9718             : 
    9719           0 :     if (low > high)              /* no matches */
    9720             :     {
    9721           0 :         *items = NULL;
    9722           0 :         return 0;
    9723             :     }
    9724             : 
    9725             :     /*
    9726             :      * Now determine how many items match the object.  The search loop
    9727             :      * invariant still holds: only items between low and high inclusive could
    9728             :      * match.
    9729             :      */
    9730           0 :     nmatch = 1;
    9731           0 :     while (middle > low)
    9732             :     {
    9733           0 :         if (classoid != middle[-1].classoid ||
    9734           0 :             objoid != middle[-1].objoid)
    9735             :             break;
    9736           0 :         middle--;
    9737           0 :         nmatch++;
    9738             :     }
    9739             : 
    9740           0 :     *items = middle;
    9741             : 
    9742           0 :     middle += nmatch;
    9743           0 :     while (middle <= high)
    9744             :     {
    9745           0 :         if (classoid != middle->classoid ||
    9746           0 :             objoid != middle->objoid)
    9747             :             break;
    9748           0 :         middle++;
    9749           0 :         nmatch++;
    9750             :     }
    9751             : 
    9752           0 :     return nmatch;
    9753             : }
    9754             : 
    9755             : /*
    9756             :  * collectComments --
    9757             :  *
    9758             :  * Construct a table of all comments available for database objects.
    9759             :  * We used to do per-object queries for the comments, but it's much faster
    9760             :  * to pull them all over at once, and on most databases the memory cost
    9761             :  * isn't high.
    9762             :  *
    9763             :  * The table is sorted by classoid/objid/objsubid for speed in lookup.
    9764             :  */
    9765             : static int
    9766           0 : collectComments(Archive *fout, CommentItem **items)
    9767             : {
    9768             :     PGresult   *res;
    9769             :     PQExpBuffer query;
    9770             :     int         i_description;
    9771             :     int         i_classoid;
    9772             :     int         i_objoid;
    9773             :     int         i_objsubid;
    9774             :     int         ntups;
    9775             :     int         i;
    9776             :     CommentItem *comments;
    9777             : 
    9778           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
    9779             : 
    9780           0 :     appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "SELECT description, classoid, objoid, objsubid "
    9781             :                          "FROM pg_catalog.pg_description "
    9782             :                          "ORDER BY classoid, objoid, objsubid");
    9783             : 
    9784           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQuery(fout, query->data, PGRES_TUPLES_OK);
    9785             : 
    9786             :     /* Construct lookup table containing OIDs in numeric form */
    9787             : 
    9788           0 :     i_description = PQfnumber(res, "description");
    9789           0 :     i_classoid = PQfnumber(res, "classoid");
    9790           0 :     i_objoid = PQfnumber(res, "objoid");
    9791           0 :     i_objsubid = PQfnumber(res, "objsubid");
    9792             : 
    9793           0 :     ntups = PQntuples(res);
    9794             : 
    9795           0 :     comments = (CommentItem *) pg_malloc(ntups * sizeof(CommentItem));
    9796             : 
    9797           0 :     for (i = 0; i < ntups; i++)
    9798             :     {
    9799           0 :         comments[i].descr = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_description);
    9800           0 :         comments[i].classoid = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_classoid));
    9801           0 :         comments[i].objoid = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_objoid));
    9802           0 :         comments[i].objsubid = atoi(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_objsubid));
    9803             :     }
    9804             : 
    9805             :     /* Do NOT free the PGresult since we are keeping pointers into it */
    9806           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
    9807             : 
    9808           0 :     *items = comments;
    9809           0 :     return ntups;
    9810             : }
    9811             : 
    9812             : /*
    9813             :  * dumpDumpableObject
    9814             :  *
    9815             :  * This routine and its subsidiaries are responsible for creating
    9816             :  * ArchiveEntries (TOC objects) for each object to be dumped.
    9817             :  */
    9818             : static void
    9819           0 : dumpDumpableObject(Archive *fout, DumpableObject *dobj)
    9820             : {
    9821           0 :     switch (dobj->objType)
    9822             :     {
    9823             :         case DO_NAMESPACE:

    9825           0 :             break;
    9826             :         case DO_EXTENSION:

    9828           0 :             break;

    9831           0 :             break;
    9832             :         case DO_SHELL_TYPE:

    9834           0 :             break;

    9836           0 :             dumpFunc(fout, (FuncInfo *) dobj);
    9837           0 :             break;

    9839           0 :             dumpAgg(fout, (AggInfo *) dobj);
    9840           0 :             break;

    9842           0 :             dumpOpr(fout, (OprInfo *) dobj);
    9843           0 :             break;
    9844             :         case DO_ACCESS_METHOD:
    9845           0 :             dumpAccessMethod(fout, (AccessMethodInfo *) dobj);
    9846           0 :             break;
    9847             :         case DO_OPCLASS:
    9848           0 :             dumpOpclass(fout, (OpclassInfo *) dobj);
    9849           0 :             break;
    9850             :         case DO_OPFAMILY:
    9851           0 :             dumpOpfamily(fout, (OpfamilyInfo *) dobj);
    9852           0 :             break;

    9855           0 :             break;

    9858           0 :             break;

    9864           0 :             break;

    9867           0 :             break;
    9868             :         case DO_INDEX_ATTACH:

    9870           0 :             break;
    9871             :         case DO_STATSEXT:

    9873           0 :             break;

    9876           0 :             break;

    9915           0 :             break;

    9917           0 :             dumpTSTemplate(fout, (TSTemplateInfo *) dobj);
    9918           0 :             break;
    9919             :         case DO_TSCONFIG:
    9920           0 :             dumpTSConfig(fout, (TSConfigInfo *) dobj);
    9921           0 :             break;
    9922             :         case DO_FDW:
    9923           0 :             dumpForeignDataWrapper(fout, (FdwInfo *) dobj);
    9924           0 :             break;
    9925             :         case DO_FOREIGN_SERVER:
    9926           0 :             dumpForeignServer(fout, (ForeignServerInfo *) dobj);
    9927           0 :             break;
    9928             :         case DO_DEFAULT_ACL:
    9929           0 :             dumpDefaultACL(fout, (DefaultACLInfo *) dobj);
    9930           0 :             break;
    9931             :         case DO_BLOB:
    9932           0 :             dumpBlob(fout, (BlobInfo *) dobj);
    9933           0 :             break;
    9934             :         case DO_BLOB_DATA:
    9935           0 :             if (dobj->dump & DUMP_COMPONENT_DATA)
    9936             :             {
    9937             :                 TocEntry   *te;
    9938             : 
    9939           0 :                 te = ArchiveEntry(fout, dobj->catId, dobj->dumpId,
    9940           0 :                                   ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = dobj->name,
    9941             :                                                .description = "BLOBS",
    9942             :                                                .section = SECTION_DATA,
    9943             :                                                .dumpFn = dumpBlobs));
    9944             : 
    9945             :                 /*
    9946             :                  * Set the TocEntry's dataLength in case we are doing a
    9947             :                  * parallel dump and want to order dump jobs by table size.
    9948             :                  * (We need some size estimate for every TocEntry with a
    9949             :                  * DataDumper function.)  We don't currently have any cheap
    9950             :                  * way to estimate the size of blobs, but it doesn't matter;
    9951             :                  * let's just set the size to a large value so parallel dumps
    9952             :                  * will launch this job first.  If there's lots of blobs, we
    9953             :                  * win, and if there aren't, we don't lose much.  (If you want
    9954             :                  * to improve on this, really what you should be thinking
    9955             :                  * about is allowing blob dumping to be parallelized, not just
    9956             :                  * getting a smarter estimate for the single TOC entry.)
    9957             :                  */
    9958           0 :                 te->dataLength = MaxBlockNumber;
    9959             :             }
    9960           0 :             break;
    9961             :         case DO_POLICY:
    9962           0 :             dumpPolicy(fout, (PolicyInfo *) dobj);
    9963           0 :             break;
    9964             :         case DO_PUBLICATION:
    9965           0 :             dumpPublication(fout, (PublicationInfo *) dobj);
    9966           0 :             break;
    9967             :         case DO_PUBLICATION_REL:
    9968           0 :             dumpPublicationTable(fout, (PublicationRelInfo *) dobj);
    9969           0 :             break;
    9970             :         case DO_SUBSCRIPTION:
    9971           0 :             dumpSubscription(fout, (SubscriptionInfo *) dobj);
    9972           0 :             break;

   10041             : /*
   10042             :  * dumpExtension
   10043             :  *    writes out to fout the queries to recreate an extension
   10044             :  */
   10045             : static void
   10046           0 : dumpExtension(Archive *fout, ExtensionInfo *extinfo)
   10047             : {
   10048           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   10049             :     PQExpBuffer q;
   10050             :     PQExpBuffer delq;
   10051             :     char       *qextname;
   10052             : 
   10053             :     /* Skip if not to be dumped */
   10054           0 :     if (!extinfo->dobj.dump || dopt->dataOnly)
   10055           0 :         return;
   10056             : 
   10057           0 :     q = createPQExpBuffer();
   10058           0 :     delq = createPQExpBuffer();
   10059             : 
   10060           0 :     qextname = pg_strdup(fmtId(extinfo->dobj.name));
   10061             : 
   10062           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(delq, "DROP EXTENSION %s;\n", qextname);
   10063             : 
   10064           0 :     if (!dopt->binary_upgrade)
   10065             :     {
   10066             :         /*
   10067             :          * In a regular dump, we simply create the extension, intentionally
   10068             :          * not specifying a version, so that the destination installation's
   10069             :          * default version is used.
   10070             :          *
   10071             :          * Use of IF NOT EXISTS here is unlike our behavior for other object
   10072             :          * types; but there are various scenarios in which it's convenient to
   10073             :          * manually create the desired extension before restoring, so we
   10074             :          * prefer to allow it to exist already.
   10075             :          */
   10076           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS %s WITH SCHEMA %s;\n",
   10077           0 :                           qextname, fmtId(extinfo->namespace));
   10078             :     }
   10079             :     else
   10080             :     {
   10081             :         /*
   10082             :          * In binary-upgrade mode, it's critical to reproduce the state of the
   10083             :          * database exactly, so our procedure is to create an empty extension,
   10084             :          * restore all the contained objects normally, and add them to the
   10085             :          * extension one by one.  This function performs just the first of
   10086             :          * those steps.  binary_upgrade_extension_member() takes care of
   10087             :          * adding member objects as they're created.
   10088             :          */
   10089             :         int         i;
   10090             :         int         n;
   10091             : 
   10092           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "-- For binary upgrade, create an empty extension and insert objects into it\n");
   10093             : 
   10094             :         /*
   10095             :          * We unconditionally create the extension, so we must drop it if it
   10096             :          * exists.  This could happen if the user deleted 'plpgsql' and then
   10097             :          * readded it, causing its oid to be greater than g_last_builtin_oid.
   10098             :          */
   10099           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "DROP EXTENSION IF EXISTS %s;\n", qextname);
   10100             : 
   10101           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q,
   10102             :                              "SELECT pg_catalog.binary_upgrade_create_empty_extension(");
   10103           0 :         appendStringLiteralAH(q, extinfo->dobj.name, fout);
   10104           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ", ");
   10105           0 :         appendStringLiteralAH(q, extinfo->namespace, fout);
   10106           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ", ");
   10107           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "%s, ", extinfo->relocatable ? "true" : "false");
   10108           0 :         appendStringLiteralAH(q, extinfo->extversion, fout);
   10109           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ", ");
   10110             : 
   10111             :         /*
   10112             :          * Note that we're pushing extconfig (an OID array) back into
   10113             :          * pg_extension exactly as-is.  This is OK because pg_class OIDs are
   10114             :          * preserved in binary upgrade.
   10115             :          */
   10116           0 :         if (strlen(extinfo->extconfig) > 2)
   10117           0 :             appendStringLiteralAH(q, extinfo->extconfig, fout);
   10118             :         else
   10119           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "NULL");
   10120           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ", ");
   10121           0 :         if (strlen(extinfo->extcondition) > 2)
   10122           0 :             appendStringLiteralAH(q, extinfo->extcondition, fout);
   10123             :         else
   10124           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "NULL");
   10125           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ", ");
   10126           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "ARRAY[");
   10127           0 :         n = 0;
   10128           0 :         for (i = 0; i < extinfo->dobj.nDeps; i++)
   10129             :         {
   10130             :             DumpableObject *extobj;
   10131             : 
   10132           0 :             extobj = findObjectByDumpId(extinfo->dobj.dependencies[i]);
   10133           0 :             if (extobj && extobj->objType == DO_EXTENSION)
   10134             :             {
   10135           0 :                 if (n++ > 0)
   10136           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferChar(q, ',');
   10137           0 :                 appendStringLiteralAH(q, extobj->name, fout);
   10138             :             }
   10139             :         }
   10140           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "]::pg_catalog.text[]");
   10141           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ");\n");
   10142             :     }
   10143             : 
   10144           0 :     if (extinfo->dobj.dump & DUMP_COMPONENT_DEFINITION)
   10145           0 :         ArchiveEntry(fout, extinfo->dobj.catId, extinfo->dobj.dumpId,
   10146           0 :                      ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = extinfo->dobj.name,
   10147             :                                   .description = "EXTENSION",
   10148             :                                   .section = SECTION_PRE_DATA,
   10149             :                                   .createStmt = q->data,
   10150             :                                   .dropStmt = delq->data));

   10170             :  * dumpType

   10173             : static void
   10174           0 : dumpType(Archive *fout, TypeInfo *tyinfo)
   10175             : {
   10176           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   10177             : 
   10178             :     /* Skip if not to be dumped */
   10179           0 :     if (!tyinfo->dobj.dump || dopt->dataOnly)
   10180           0 :         return;
   10181             : 
   10182             :     /* Dump out in proper style */
   10183           0 :     if (tyinfo->typtype == TYPTYPE_BASE)
   10184           0 :         dumpBaseType(fout, tyinfo);
   10185           0 :     else if (tyinfo->typtype == TYPTYPE_DOMAIN)
   10186           0 :         dumpDomain(fout, tyinfo);
   10187           0 :     else if (tyinfo->typtype == TYPTYPE_COMPOSITE)
   10188           0 :         dumpCompositeType(fout, tyinfo);
   10189           0 :     else if (tyinfo->typtype == TYPTYPE_ENUM)
   10190           0 :         dumpEnumType(fout, tyinfo);
   10191           0 :     else if (tyinfo->typtype == TYPTYPE_RANGE)
   10192           0 :         dumpRangeType(fout, tyinfo);
   10193           0 :     else if (tyinfo->typtype == TYPTYPE_PSEUDO && !tyinfo->isDefined)
   10194           0 :         dumpUndefinedType(fout, tyinfo);
   10195             :     else
   10196           0 :         pg_log_warning("typtype of data type \"%s\" appears to be invalid",
   10197             :                        tyinfo->dobj.name);
   10198             : }

   10328             : /*
   10329             :  * dumpRangeType
   10330             :  *    writes out to fout the queries to recreate a user-defined range type
   10331             :  */
   10332             : static void
   10333           0 : dumpRangeType(Archive *fout, TypeInfo *tyinfo)
   10334             : {
   10335           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   10336           0 :     PQExpBuffer q = createPQExpBuffer();
   10337           0 :     PQExpBuffer delq = createPQExpBuffer();
   10338           0 :     PQExpBuffer query = createPQExpBuffer();
   10339             :     PGresult   *res;
   10340             :     Oid         collationOid;
   10341             :     char       *qtypname;
   10342             :     char       *qualtypname;
   10343             :     char       *procname;
   10344             : 
   10345           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(query,
   10346             :                       "SELECT pg_catalog.format_type(rngsubtype, NULL) AS rngsubtype, "
   10347             :                       "opc.opcname AS opcname, "
   10348             :                       "(SELECT nspname FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace nsp "
   10349             :                       "  WHERE nsp.oid = opc.opcnamespace) AS opcnsp, "
   10350             :                       "opc.opcdefault, "
   10351             :                       "CASE WHEN rngcollation = st.typcollation THEN 0 "
   10352             :                       "     ELSE rngcollation END AS collation, "
   10353             :                       "rngcanonical, rngsubdiff "
   10354             :                       "FROM pg_catalog.pg_range r, pg_catalog.pg_type st, "
   10355             :                       "     pg_catalog.pg_opclass opc "
   10356             :                       "WHERE st.oid = rngsubtype AND opc.oid = rngsubopc AND "
   10357             :                       "rngtypid = '%u'",
   10358             :                       tyinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   10359             : 
   10360           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQueryForSingleRow(fout, query->data);
   10361             : 
   10362           0 :     qtypname = pg_strdup(fmtId(tyinfo->dobj.name));
   10363           0 :     qualtypname = pg_strdup(fmtQualifiedDumpable(tyinfo));

   10366             :      * CASCADE shouldn't be required here as for normal types since the I/O

   10368             :      */
   10369           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(delq, "DROP TYPE %s;\n", qualtypname);
   10370             :

   10372           0 :         binary_upgrade_set_type_oids_by_type_oid(fout, q,
   10373             :                                                  tyinfo->dobj.catId.oid,

   10412             :

   10414           0 :         binary_upgrade_extension_member(q, &tyinfo->dobj,

   10454             : /*
   10455             :  * dumpUndefinedType
   10456             :  *    writes out to fout the queries to recreate a !typisdefined type
   10457             :  *
   10458             :  * This is a shell type, but we use different terminology to distinguish
   10459             :  * this case from where we have to emit a shell type definition to break
   10460             :  * circular dependencies.  An undefined type shouldn't ever have anything
   10461             :  * depending on it.
   10462             :  */
   10463             : static void
   10464           0 : dumpUndefinedType(Archive *fout, TypeInfo *tyinfo)
   10465             : {
   10466           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   10467           0 :     PQExpBuffer q = createPQExpBuffer();
   10468           0 :     PQExpBuffer delq = createPQExpBuffer();

   10470             :     char       *qualtypname;
   10471             : 
   10472           0 :     qtypname = pg_strdup(fmtId(tyinfo->dobj.name));
   10473           0 :     qualtypname = pg_strdup(fmtQualifiedDumpable(tyinfo));
   10474             : 
   10475           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(delq, "DROP TYPE %s;\n", qualtypname);
   10476             : 
   10477           0 :     if (dopt->binary_upgrade)
   10478           0 :         binary_upgrade_set_type_oids_by_type_oid(fout, q,
   10479             :                                                  tyinfo->dobj.catId.oid,
   10480             :                                                  false);
   10481             : 
   10482           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(q, "CREATE TYPE %s;\n",
   10483             :                       qualtypname);
   10484             : 
   10485           0 :     if (dopt->binary_upgrade)
   10486           0 :         binary_upgrade_extension_member(q, &tyinfo->dobj,
   10487             :                                         "TYPE", qtypname,
   10488           0 :                                         tyinfo->dobj.namespace->dobj.name);
   10489             : 
   10490           0 :     if (tyinfo->dobj.dump & DUMP_COMPONENT_DEFINITION)
   10491           0 :         ArchiveEntry(fout, tyinfo->dobj.catId, tyinfo->dobj.dumpId,
   10492           0 :                      ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = tyinfo->dobj.name,
   10493             :                                   .namespace = tyinfo->dobj.namespace->dobj.name,
   10494             :                                   .owner = tyinfo->rolname,

   10807             : /*
   10808             :  * dumpDomain
   10809             :  *    writes out to fout the queries to recreate a user-defined domain
   10810             :  */
   10811             : static void
   10812           0 : dumpDomain(Archive *fout, TypeInfo *tyinfo)
   10813             : {
   10814           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   10815           0 :     PQExpBuffer q = createPQExpBuffer();
   10816           0 :     PQExpBuffer delq = createPQExpBuffer();
   10817           0 :     PQExpBuffer query = createPQExpBuffer();
   10818             :     PGresult   *res;
   10819             :     int         i;
   10820             :     char       *qtypname;
   10821             :     char       *qualtypname;
   10822             :     char       *typnotnull;
   10823             :     char       *typdefn;
   10824             :     char       *typdefault;
   10825             :     Oid         typcollation;
   10826           0 :     bool        typdefault_is_literal = false;
   10827             : 
   10828             :     /* Fetch domain specific details */
   10829           0 :     if (fout->remoteVersion >= 90100)
   10830             :     {
   10831             :         /* typcollation is new in 9.1 */
   10832           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "SELECT t.typnotnull, "
   10833             :                           "pg_catalog.format_type(t.typbasetype, t.typtypmod) AS typdefn, "
   10834             :                           "pg_catalog.pg_get_expr(t.typdefaultbin, 'pg_catalog.pg_type'::pg_catalog.regclass) AS typdefaultbin, "
   10835             :                           "t.typdefault, "

   10837             :                           "THEN t.typcollation ELSE 0 END AS typcollation "

   10839             :                           "LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_type u ON (t.typbasetype = u.oid) "
   10840             :                           "WHERE t.oid = '%u'::pg_catalog.oid",
   10841             :                           tyinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   10842             :     }

   11004             :     int         actual_atts;
   11005             : 
   11006             :     /* Fetch type specific details */

   11008             :     {
   11009             :         /*
   11010             :          * attcollation is new in 9.1.  Since we only want to dump COLLATE
   11011             :          * clauses for attributes whose collation is different from their
   11012             :          * type's default, we use a CASE here to suppress uninteresting
   11013             :          * attcollations cheaply.  atttypid will be 0 for dropped columns;
   11014             :          * collation does not matter for those.
   11015             :          */
   11016           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "SELECT a.attname, "
   11017             :                           "pg_catalog.format_type(a.atttypid, a.atttypmod) AS atttypdefn, "
   11018             :                           "a.attlen, a.attalign, a.attisdropped, "
   11019             :                           "CASE WHEN a.attcollation <> at.typcollation "
   11020             :                           "THEN a.attcollation ELSE 0 END AS attcollation "
   11021             :                           "FROM pg_catalog.pg_type ct "
   11022             :                           "JOIN pg_catalog.pg_attribute a ON a.attrelid = ct.typrelid "

   11026             :                           tyinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   11027             :     }

   11190             : /*
   11191             :  * dumpCompositeTypeColComments
   11192             :  *    writes out to fout the queries to recreate comments on the columns of

   11194             :  */
   11195             : static void
   11196           0 : dumpCompositeTypeColComments(Archive *fout, TypeInfo *tyinfo)
   11197             : {
   11198             :     CommentItem *comments;
   11199             :     int         ncomments;
   11200             :     PGresult   *res;
   11201             :     PQExpBuffer query;
   11202             :     PQExpBuffer target;
   11203             :     Oid         pgClassOid;
   11204             :     int         i;
   11205             :     int         ntups;
   11206             :     int         i_attname;
   11207             :     int         i_attnum;
   11208             : 
   11209             :     /* do nothing, if --no-comments is supplied */
   11210           0 :     if (fout->dopt->no_comments)
   11211           0 :         return;
   11212             : 
   11213           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   11214             : 
   11215           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(query,
   11216             :                       "SELECT c.tableoid, a.attname, a.attnum "
   11217             :                       "FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c, pg_catalog.pg_attribute a "
   11218             :                       "WHERE c.oid = '%u' AND c.oid = a.attrelid "
   11219             :                       "  AND NOT a.attisdropped "
   11220             :                       "ORDER BY a.attnum ",
   11221             :                       tyinfo->typrelid);
   11222             : 
   11223             :     /* Fetch column attnames */
   11224           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQuery(fout, query->data, PGRES_TUPLES_OK);
   11225             : 
   11226           0 :     ntups = PQntuples(res);
   11227           0 :     if (ntups < 1)
   11228             :     {
   11229           0 :         PQclear(res);
   11230           0 :         destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   11231           0 :         return;
   11232             :     }
   11233             : 
   11234           0 :     pgClassOid = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, 0, PQfnumber(res, "tableoid")));
   11235             : 
   11236             :     /* Search for comments associated with type's pg_class OID */
   11237           0 :     ncomments = findComments(fout,
   11238             :                              pgClassOid,
   11239             :                              tyinfo->typrelid,
   11240             :                              &comments);
   11241             : 
   11242             :     /* If no comments exist, we're done */
   11243           0 :     if (ncomments <= 0)
   11244             :     {
   11245           0 :         PQclear(res);
   11246           0 :         destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   11247           0 :         return;
   11248             :     }
   11249             : 
   11250             :     /* Build COMMENT ON statements */
   11251           0 :     target = createPQExpBuffer();
   11252             : 
   11253           0 :     i_attnum = PQfnumber(res, "attnum");
   11254           0 :     i_attname = PQfnumber(res, "attname");
   11255           0 :     while (ncomments > 0)
   11256             :     {
   11257             :         const char *attname;
   11258             : 
   11259           0 :         attname = NULL;
   11260           0 :         for (i = 0; i < ntups; i++)
   11261             :         {
   11262           0 :             if (atoi(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_attnum)) == comments->objsubid)
   11263             :             {
   11264           0 :                 attname = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_attname);
   11265           0 :                 break;
   11266             :             }
   11267             :         }
   11268           0 :         if (attname)            /* just in case we don't find it */
   11269             :         {
   11270           0 :             const char *descr = comments->descr;
   11271             : 
   11272           0 :             resetPQExpBuffer(target);
   11273           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(target, "COLUMN %s.",
   11274           0 :                               fmtId(tyinfo->dobj.name));
   11275           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(target, fmtId(attname));
   11276             :

   11278           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(query, "COMMENT ON COLUMN %s.",

   11280           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(query, "%s IS ", fmtId(attname));
   11281           0 :             appendStringLiteralAH(query, descr, fout);
   11282           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(query, ";\n");
   11283             : 
   11284           0 :             ArchiveEntry(fout, nilCatalogId, createDumpId(),
   11285           0 :                          ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = target->data,
   11286             :                                       .namespace = tyinfo->dobj.namespace->dobj.name,

   11290             :                                       .createStmt = query->data,
   11291             :                                       .deps = &(tyinfo->dobj.dumpId),
   11292             :                                       .nDeps = 1));
   11293             :         }
   11294             : 
   11295           0 :         comments++;
   11296           0 :         ncomments--;
   11297             :     }
   11298             : 
   11299           0 :     PQclear(res);
   11300           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   11301           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(target);
   11302             : }
   11303             : 
   11304             : /*
   11305             :  * dumpShellType
   11306             :  *    writes out to fout the queries to create a shell type
   11307             :  *
   11308             :  * We dump a shell definition in advance of the I/O functions for the type.
   11309             :  */
   11310             : static void
   11311           0 : dumpShellType(Archive *fout, ShellTypeInfo *stinfo)
   11312             : {
   11313           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   11314             :     PQExpBuffer q;
   11315             : 
   11316             :     /* Skip if not to be dumped */
   11317           0 :     if (!stinfo->dobj.dump || dopt->dataOnly)
   11318           0 :         return;
   11319             : 
   11320           0 :     q = createPQExpBuffer();
   11321             : 
   11322             :     /*
   11323             :      * Note the lack of a DROP command for the shell type; any required DROP
   11324             :      * is driven off the base type entry, instead.  This interacts with
   11325             :      * _printTocEntry()'s use of the presence of a DROP command to decide
   11326             :      * whether an entry needs an ALTER OWNER command.  We don't want to alter
   11327             :      * the shell type's owner immediately on creation; that should happen only
   11328             :      * after it's filled in, otherwise the backend complains.
   11329             :      */
   11330             : 
   11331           0 :     if (dopt->binary_upgrade)
   11332           0 :         binary_upgrade_set_type_oids_by_type_oid(fout, q,
   11333           0 :                                                  stinfo->baseType->dobj.catId.oid,
   11334             :                                                  false);
   11335             : 
   11336           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(q, "CREATE TYPE %s;\n",
   11337           0 :                       fmtQualifiedDumpable(stinfo));
   11338             : 
   11339           0 :     if (stinfo->dobj.dump & DUMP_COMPONENT_DEFINITION)
   11340           0 :         ArchiveEntry(fout, stinfo->dobj.catId, stinfo->dobj.dumpId,
   11341           0 :                      ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = stinfo->dobj.name,
   11342             :                                   .namespace = stinfo->dobj.namespace->dobj.name,
   11343             :                                   .owner = stinfo->baseType->rolname,
   11344             :                                   .description = "SHELL TYPE",
   11345             :                                   .section = SECTION_PRE_DATA,
   11346             :                                   .createStmt = q->data));
   11347             : 
   11348           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(q);

   11351             : /*
   11352             :  * dumpProcLang
   11353             :  *        writes out to fout the queries to recreate a user-defined
   11354             :  *        procedural language
   11355             :  */
   11356             : static void
   11357           0 : dumpProcLang(Archive *fout, ProcLangInfo *plang)
   11358             : {
   11359           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   11360             :     PQExpBuffer defqry;
   11361             :     PQExpBuffer delqry;
   11362             :     bool        useParams;
   11363             :     char       *qlanname;
   11364             :     FuncInfo   *funcInfo;
   11365           0 :     FuncInfo   *inlineInfo = NULL;
   11366           0 :     FuncInfo   *validatorInfo = NULL;
   11367             : 
   11368             :     /* Skip if not to be dumped */
   11369           0 :     if (!plang->dobj.dump || dopt->dataOnly)
   11370           0 :         return;
   11371             : 
   11372             :     /*
   11373             :      * Try to find the support function(s).  It is not an error if we don't
   11374             :      * find them --- if the functions are in the pg_catalog schema, as is
   11375             :      * standard in 8.1 and up, then we won't have loaded them. (In this case
   11376             :      * we will emit a parameterless CREATE LANGUAGE command, which will
   11377             :      * require PL template knowledge in the backend to reload.)
   11378             :      */
   11379             : 
   11380           0 :     funcInfo = findFuncByOid(plang->lanplcallfoid);
   11381           0 :     if (funcInfo != NULL && !funcInfo->dobj.dump)
   11382           0 :         funcInfo = NULL;        /* treat not-dumped same as not-found */
   11383             : 
   11384           0 :     if (OidIsValid(plang->laninline))
   11385             :     {
   11386           0 :         inlineInfo = findFuncByOid(plang->laninline);
   11387           0 :         if (inlineInfo != NULL && !inlineInfo->dobj.dump)
   11388           0 :             inlineInfo = NULL;
   11389             :     }
   11390             : 
   11391           0 :     if (OidIsValid(plang->lanvalidator))
   11392             :     {
   11393           0 :         validatorInfo = findFuncByOid(plang->lanvalidator);
   11394           0 :         if (validatorInfo != NULL && !validatorInfo->dobj.dump)
   11395           0 :             validatorInfo = NULL;
   11396             :     }
   11397             : 
   11398             :     /*
   11399             :      * If the functions are dumpable then emit a traditional CREATE LANGUAGE
   11400             :      * with parameters.  Otherwise, we'll write a parameterless command, which
   11401             :      * will rely on data from pg_pltemplate.
   11402             :      */
   11403           0 :     useParams = (funcInfo != NULL &&
   11404           0 :                  (inlineInfo != NULL || !OidIsValid(plang->laninline)) &&
   11405           0 :                  (validatorInfo != NULL || !OidIsValid(plang->lanvalidator)));
   11406             : 
   11407           0 :     defqry = createPQExpBuffer();
   11408           0 :     delqry = createPQExpBuffer();
   11409             : 
   11410           0 :     qlanname = pg_strdup(fmtId(plang->dobj.name));
   11411             : 
   11412           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(delqry, "DROP PROCEDURAL LANGUAGE %s;\n",
   11413             :                       qlanname);
   11414             : 
   11415           0 :     if (useParams)
   11416             :     {
   11417           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(defqry, "CREATE %sPROCEDURAL LANGUAGE %s",
   11418           0 :                           plang->lanpltrusted ? "TRUSTED " : "",

   11424           0 :                               fmtQualifiedDumpable(inlineInfo));

   11426           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(defqry, " VALIDATOR %s",
   11427           0 :                               fmtQualifiedDumpable(validatorInfo));
   11428             :     }
   11429             :     else
   11430             :     {
   11431             :         /*
   11432             :          * If not dumping parameters, then use CREATE OR REPLACE so that the
   11433             :          * command will not fail if the language is preinstalled in the target
   11434             :          * database.  We restrict the use of REPLACE to this case so as to
   11435             :          * eliminate the risk of replacing a language with incompatible
   11436             :          * parameter settings: this command will only succeed at all if there
   11437             :          * is a pg_pltemplate entry, and if there is one, the existing entry
   11438             :          * must match it too.
   11439             :          */

   11482             : /*
   11483             :  * format_function_arguments: generate function name and argument list
   11484             :  *
   11485             :  * This is used when we can rely on pg_get_function_arguments to format
   11486             :  * the argument list.  Note, however, that pg_get_function_arguments
   11487             :  * does not special-case zero-argument aggregates.
   11488             :  */
   11489             : static char *
   11490           0 : format_function_arguments(FuncInfo *finfo, char *funcargs, bool is_agg)
   11491             : {
   11492             :     PQExpBufferData fn;
   11493             : 
   11494           0 :     initPQExpBuffer(&fn);

   11497           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(&fn, "(*)");
   11498             :     else
   11499           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(&fn, "(%s)", funcargs);
   11500           0 :     return fn.data;
   11501             : }
   11502             : 
   11503             : /*
   11504             :  * format_function_arguments_old: generate function name and argument list
   11505             :  *
   11506             :  * The argument type names are qualified if needed.  The function name
   11507             :  * is never qualified.
   11508             :  *
   11509             :  * This is used only with pre-8.4 servers, so we aren't expecting to see
   11510             :  * VARIADIC or TABLE arguments, nor are there any defaults for arguments.
   11511             :  *
   11512             :  * Any or all of allargtypes, argmodes, argnames may be NULL.
   11513             :  */
   11514             : static char *
   11515           0 : format_function_arguments_old(Archive *fout,
   11516             :                               FuncInfo *finfo, int nallargs,
   11517             :                               char **allargtypes,
   11518             :                               char **argmodes,
   11519             :                               char **argnames)
   11520             : {
   11521             :     PQExpBufferData fn;
   11522             :     int         j;
   11523             : 
   11524           0 :     initPQExpBuffer(&fn);
   11525           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(&fn, "%s(", fmtId(finfo->dobj.name));
   11526           0 :     for (j = 0; j < nallargs; j++)
   11527             :     {
   11528             :         Oid         typid;
   11529             :         char       *typname;
   11530             :         const char *argmode;
   11531             :         const char *argname;
   11532             : 
   11533           0 :         typid = allargtypes ? atooid(allargtypes[j]) : finfo->argtypes[j];
   11534           0 :         typname = getFormattedTypeName(fout, typid, zeroAsOpaque);
   11535             : 
   11536           0 :         if (argmodes)
   11537             :         {
   11538           0 :             switch (argmodes[j][0])
   11539             :             {
   11540             :                 case PROARGMODE_IN:
   11541           0 :                     argmode = "";
   11542           0 :                     break;
   11543             :                 case PROARGMODE_OUT:
   11544           0 :                     argmode = "OUT ";
   11545           0 :                     break;
   11546             :                 case PROARGMODE_INOUT:
   11547           0 :                     argmode = "INOUT ";
   11548           0 :                     break;
   11549             :                 default:
   11550           0 :                     pg_log_warning("bogus value in proargmodes array");
   11551           0 :                     argmode = "";
   11552           0 :                     break;
   11553             :             }
   11554             :         }
   11555             :         else
   11556           0 :             argmode = "";

   11568           0 :         free(typname);
   11569             :     }
   11570           0 :     appendPQExpBufferChar(&fn, ')');
   11571           0 :     return fn.data;

   11573             : 
   11574             : /*
   11575             :  * format_function_signature: generate function name and argument list
   11576             :  *
   11577             :  * This is like format_function_arguments_old except that only a minimal
   11578             :  * list of input argument types is generated; this is sufficient to
   11579             :  * reference the function, but not to define it.
   11580             :  *
   11581             :  * If honor_quotes is false then the function name is never quoted.
   11582             :  * This is appropriate for use in TOC tags, but not in SQL commands.
   11583             :  */
   11584             : static char *
   11585           0 : format_function_signature(Archive *fout, FuncInfo *finfo, bool honor_quotes)

   11588             :     int         j;

   11590           0 :     initPQExpBuffer(&fn);
   11591           0 :     if (honor_quotes)
   11592           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(&fn, "%s(", fmtId(finfo->dobj.name));
   11593             :     else
   11594           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(&fn, "%s(", finfo->dobj.name);
   11595           0 :     for (j = 0; j < finfo->nargs; j++)
   11596             :     {
   11597             :         char       *typname;
   11598             : 
   11599           0 :         if (j > 0)
   11600           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(&fn, ", ");

   11605           0 :         free(typname);

   11752           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query,
   11753             :                           "SELECT proretset, prosrc, probin, "

   11755             :                           "pg_catalog.pg_get_function_identity_arguments(oid) AS funciargs, "

   12114             :          * and then quote the elements as string literals.  (The elements may

   12116             :          * parser; it would do the wrong thing with elements that are
   12117             :          * zero-length or longer than NAMEDATALEN.)

   12202             : /*

   12205             : static void

   12207             : {
   12208           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;

   12439             : /*
   12440             :  * dumpOpr

   12445             : {

   12496             :                           "oprcode::pg_catalog.regprocedure, "

   12542           0 :     oprcom = PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_oprcom);
   12543           0 :     oprnegate = PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_oprnegate);

   12546           0 :     oprcanmerge = PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_oprcanmerge);

   12549           0 :     oprregproc = convertRegProcReference(fout, oprcode);

   12556           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(oprid, "%s (",

   12564           0 :         strcmp(oprkind, "b") == 0)

   12595           0 :     if (strcmp(oprcanmerge, "t") == 0)
