   12651             : }
   12652             : 
   12653             : /*
   12654             :  * Convert a function reference obtained from pg_operator
   12655             :  *
   12656             :  * Returns allocated string of what to print, or NULL if function references
   12657             :  * is InvalidOid. Returned string is expected to be free'd by the caller.
   12658             :  *
   12659             :  * The input is a REGPROCEDURE display; we have to strip the argument-types
   12660             :  * part.
   12661             :  */
   12662             : static char *
   12663           0 : convertRegProcReference(Archive *fout, const char *proc)
   12664             : {
   12665             :     char       *name;
   12666             :     char       *paren;
   12667             :     bool        inquote;
   12668             : 
   12669             :     /* In all cases "-" means a null reference */
   12670           0 :     if (strcmp(proc, "-") == 0)
   12671           0 :         return NULL;
   12672             : 
   12673           0 :     name = pg_strdup(proc);
   12674             :     /* find non-double-quoted left paren */
   12675           0 :     inquote = false;
   12676           0 :     for (paren = name; *paren; paren++)
   12677             :     {
   12678           0 :         if (*paren == '(' && !inquote)
   12679             :         {
   12680           0 :             *paren = '\0';
   12681           0 :             break;
   12682             :         }
   12683           0 :         if (*paren == '"')
   12684           0 :             inquote = !inquote;
   12685             :     }
   12686           0 :     return name;
   12687             : }
   12688             : 
   12689             : /*
   12690             :  * getFormattedOperatorName - retrieve the operator name for the
   12691             :  * given operator OID (presented in string form).
   12692             :  *
   12693             :  * Returns an allocated string, or NULL if the given OID is invalid.
   12694             :  * Caller is responsible for free'ing result string.
   12695             :  *
   12696             :  * What we produce has the format "OPERATOR(schema.oprname)".  This is only
   12697             :  * useful in commands where the operator's argument types can be inferred from
   12698             :  * context.  We always schema-qualify the name, though.  The predecessor to
   12699             :  * this code tried to skip the schema qualification if possible, but that led
   12700             :  * to wrong results in corner cases, such as if an operator and its negator
   12701             :  * are in different schemas.
   12702             :  */
   12703             : static char *
   12704           0 : getFormattedOperatorName(Archive *fout, const char *oproid)
   12705             : {
   12706             :     OprInfo    *oprInfo;
   12707             : 
   12708             :     /* In all cases "0" means a null reference */
   12709           0 :     if (strcmp(oproid, "0") == 0)
   12710           0 :         return NULL;
   12711             : 
   12712           0 :     oprInfo = findOprByOid(atooid(oproid));
   12713           0 :     if (oprInfo == NULL)
   12714             :     {
   12715           0 :         pg_log_warning("could not find operator with OID %s",
   12716             :                        oproid);
   12717           0 :         return NULL;
   12718             :     }
   12719             : 
   12720           0 :     return psprintf("OPERATOR(%s.%s)",
   12721           0 :                     fmtId(oprInfo->dobj.namespace->dobj.name),
   12722             :                     oprInfo->dobj.name);
   12723             : }
   12724             : 
   12725             : /*
   12726             :  * Convert a function OID obtained from pg_ts_parser or pg_ts_template
   12727             :  *
   12728             :  * It is sufficient to use REGPROC rather than REGPROCEDURE, since the
   12729             :  * argument lists of these functions are predetermined.  Note that the
   12730             :  * caller should ensure we are in the proper schema, because the results
   12731             :  * are search path dependent!
   12732             :  */
   12733             : static char *
   12734           0 : convertTSFunction(Archive *fout, Oid funcOid)
   12735             : {
   12736             :     char       *result;
   12737             :     char        query[128];
   12738             :     PGresult   *res;
   12739             : 
   12740           0 :     snprintf(query, sizeof(query),
   12741             :              "SELECT '%u'::pg_catalog.regproc", funcOid);
   12742           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQueryForSingleRow(fout, query);
   12743             : 
   12744           0 :     result = pg_strdup(PQgetvalue(res, 0, 0));
   12745             : 
   12746           0 :     PQclear(res);
   12747             : 
   12748           0 :     return result;
   12749             : }
   12750             : 
   12751             : /*
   12752             :  * dumpAccessMethod
   12753             :  *    write out a single access method definition
   12754             :  */
   12755             : static void
   12756           0 : dumpAccessMethod(Archive *fout, AccessMethodInfo *aminfo)
   12757             : {
   12758           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   12759             :     PQExpBuffer q;
   12760             :     PQExpBuffer delq;
   12761             :     char       *qamname;
   12762             : 
   12763             :     /* Skip if not to be dumped */
   12764           0 :     if (!aminfo->dobj.dump || dopt->dataOnly)
   12765           0 :         return;
   12766             : 
   12767           0 :     q = createPQExpBuffer();
   12768           0 :     delq = createPQExpBuffer();
   12769             : 
   12770           0 :     qamname = pg_strdup(fmtId(aminfo->dobj.name));
   12771             : 
   12772           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(q, "CREATE ACCESS METHOD %s ", qamname);
   12773             : 
   12774           0 :     switch (aminfo->amtype)
   12775             :     {
   12776             :         case AMTYPE_INDEX:
   12777           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "TYPE INDEX ");
   12778           0 :             break;
   12779             :         case AMTYPE_TABLE:
   12780           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "TYPE TABLE ");
   12781           0 :             break;
   12782             :         default:
   12783           0 :             pg_log_warning("invalid type \"%c\" of access method \"%s\"",
   12784             :                            aminfo->amtype, qamname);
   12785           0 :             destroyPQExpBuffer(q);
   12786           0 :             destroyPQExpBuffer(delq);
   12787           0 :             free(qamname);
   12788           0 :             return;
   12789             :     }
   12790             : 
   12791           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(q, "HANDLER %s;\n", aminfo->amhandler);
   12792             : 
   12793           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(delq, "DROP ACCESS METHOD %s;\n",
   12794             :                       qamname);
   12795             : 
   12796           0 :     if (dopt->binary_upgrade)
   12797           0 :         binary_upgrade_extension_member(q, &aminfo->dobj,
   12798             :                                         "ACCESS METHOD", qamname, NULL);
   12799             : 
   12800           0 :     if (aminfo->dobj.dump & DUMP_COMPONENT_DEFINITION)
   12801           0 :         ArchiveEntry(fout, aminfo->dobj.catId, aminfo->dobj.dumpId,
   12802           0 :                      ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = aminfo->dobj.name,
   12803             :                                   .description = "ACCESS METHOD",
   12804             :                                   .section = SECTION_PRE_DATA,
   12805             :                                   .createStmt = q->data,
   12806             :                                   .dropStmt = delq->data));
   12807             : 
   12808             :     /* Dump Access Method Comments */
   12809           0 :     if (aminfo->dobj.dump & DUMP_COMPONENT_COMMENT)
   12810           0 :         dumpComment(fout, "ACCESS METHOD", qamname,
   12811             :                     NULL, "",
   12812             :                     aminfo->dobj.catId, 0, aminfo->dobj.dumpId);
   12813             : 
   12814           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(q);
   12815           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(delq);
   12816           0 :     free(qamname);
   12817             : }
   12818             : 
   12819             : /*
   12820             :  * dumpOpclass
   12821             :  *    write out a single operator class definition
   12822             :  */
   12823             : static void
   12824           0 : dumpOpclass(Archive *fout, OpclassInfo *opcinfo)
   12825             : {
   12826           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   12827             :     PQExpBuffer query;
   12828             :     PQExpBuffer q;
   12829             :     PQExpBuffer delq;
   12830             :     PQExpBuffer nameusing;
   12831             :     PGresult   *res;
   12832             :     int         ntups;
   12833             :     int         i_opcintype;
   12834             :     int         i_opckeytype;
   12835             :     int         i_opcdefault;
   12836             :     int         i_opcfamily;
   12837             :     int         i_opcfamilyname;
   12838             :     int         i_opcfamilynsp;
   12839             :     int         i_amname;
   12840             :     int         i_amopstrategy;
   12841             :     int         i_amopreqcheck;
   12842             :     int         i_amopopr;
   12843             :     int         i_sortfamily;
   12844             :     int         i_sortfamilynsp;
   12845             :     int         i_amprocnum;
   12846             :     int         i_amproc;
   12847             :     int         i_amproclefttype;
   12848             :     int         i_amprocrighttype;
   12849             :     char       *opcintype;
   12850             :     char       *opckeytype;
   12851             :     char       *opcdefault;
   12852             :     char       *opcfamily;
   12853             :     char       *opcfamilyname;
   12854             :     char       *opcfamilynsp;
   12855             :     char       *amname;
   12856             :     char       *amopstrategy;
   12857             :     char       *amopreqcheck;
   12858             :     char       *amopopr;
   12859             :     char       *sortfamily;
   12860             :     char       *sortfamilynsp;
   12861             :     char       *amprocnum;
   12862             :     char       *amproc;
   12863             :     char       *amproclefttype;
   12864             :     char       *amprocrighttype;
   12865             :     bool        needComma;
   12866             :     int         i;
   12867             : 
   12868             :     /* Skip if not to be dumped */
   12869           0 :     if (!opcinfo->dobj.dump || dopt->dataOnly)
   12870           0 :         return;
   12871             : 
   12872           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   12873           0 :     q = createPQExpBuffer();
   12874           0 :     delq = createPQExpBuffer();
   12875           0 :     nameusing = createPQExpBuffer();
   12876             : 
   12877             :     /* Get additional fields from the pg_opclass row */
   12878           0 :     if (fout->remoteVersion >= 80300)
   12879             :     {
   12880           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "SELECT opcintype::pg_catalog.regtype, "
   12881             :                           "opckeytype::pg_catalog.regtype, "
   12882             :                           "opcdefault, opcfamily, "
   12883             :                           "opfname AS opcfamilyname, "
   12884             :                           "nspname AS opcfamilynsp, "
   12885             :                           "(SELECT amname FROM pg_catalog.pg_am WHERE oid = opcmethod) AS amname "
   12886             :                           "FROM pg_catalog.pg_opclass c "
   12887             :                           "LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_opfamily f ON f.oid = opcfamily "
   12888             :                           "LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = opfnamespace "
   12889             :                           "WHERE c.oid = '%u'::pg_catalog.oid",
   12890             :                           opcinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   12891             :     }
   12892             :     else
   12893             :     {
   12894           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "SELECT opcintype::pg_catalog.regtype, "
   12895             :                           "opckeytype::pg_catalog.regtype, "
   12896             :                           "opcdefault, NULL AS opcfamily, "
   12897             :                           "NULL AS opcfamilyname, "
   12898             :                           "NULL AS opcfamilynsp, "
   12899             :                           "(SELECT amname FROM pg_catalog.pg_am WHERE oid = opcamid) AS amname "
   12900             :                           "FROM pg_catalog.pg_opclass "
   12901             :                           "WHERE oid = '%u'::pg_catalog.oid",
   12902             :                           opcinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   12903             :     }
   12904             : 
   12905           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQueryForSingleRow(fout, query->data);
   12906             : 
   12907           0 :     i_opcintype = PQfnumber(res, "opcintype");
   12908           0 :     i_opckeytype = PQfnumber(res, "opckeytype");
   12909           0 :     i_opcdefault = PQfnumber(res, "opcdefault");
   12910           0 :     i_opcfamily = PQfnumber(res, "opcfamily");
   12911           0 :     i_opcfamilyname = PQfnumber(res, "opcfamilyname");
   12912           0 :     i_opcfamilynsp = PQfnumber(res, "opcfamilynsp");
   12913           0 :     i_amname = PQfnumber(res, "amname");
   12914             : 
   12915             :     /* opcintype may still be needed after we PQclear res */
   12916           0 :     opcintype = pg_strdup(PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_opcintype));
   12917           0 :     opckeytype = PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_opckeytype);
   12918           0 :     opcdefault = PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_opcdefault);
   12919             :     /* opcfamily will still be needed after we PQclear res */
   12920           0 :     opcfamily = pg_strdup(PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_opcfamily));
   12921           0 :     opcfamilyname = PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_opcfamilyname);
   12922           0 :     opcfamilynsp = PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_opcfamilynsp);
   12923             :     /* amname will still be needed after we PQclear res */
   12924           0 :     amname = pg_strdup(PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_amname));
   12925             : 
   12926           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(delq, "DROP OPERATOR CLASS %s",
   12927           0 :                       fmtQualifiedDumpable(opcinfo));
   12928           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(delq, " USING %s;\n",
   12929             :                       fmtId(amname));
   12930             : 
   12931             :     /* Build the fixed portion of the CREATE command */
   12932           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(q, "CREATE OPERATOR CLASS %s\n    ",
   12933           0 :                       fmtQualifiedDumpable(opcinfo));
   12934           0 :     if (strcmp(opcdefault, "t") == 0)
   12935           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "DEFAULT ");
   12936           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(q, "FOR TYPE %s USING %s",
   12937             :                       opcintype,
   12938             :                       fmtId(amname));
   12939           0 :     if (strlen(opcfamilyname) > 0)
   12940             :     {
   12941           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, " FAMILY ");
   12942           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "%s.", fmtId(opcfamilynsp));
   12943           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, fmtId(opcfamilyname));
   12944             :     }
   12945           0 :     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, " AS\n    ");
   12946             : 
   12947           0 :     needComma = false;
   12948             : 
   12949           0 :     if (strcmp(opckeytype, "-") != 0)
   12950             :     {
   12951           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "STORAGE %s",
   12952             :                           opckeytype);
   12953           0 :         needComma = true;
   12954             :     }
   12955             : 
   12956           0 :     PQclear(res);
   12957             : 
   12958             :     /*
   12959             :      * Now fetch and print the OPERATOR entries (pg_amop rows).
   12960             :      *
   12961             :      * Print only those opfamily members that are tied to the opclass by
   12962             :      * pg_depend entries.
   12963             :      *
   12964             :      * XXX RECHECK is gone as of 8.4, but we'll still print it if dumping an
   12965             :      * older server's opclass in which it is used.  This is to avoid
   12966             :      * hard-to-detect breakage if a newer pg_dump is used to dump from an
   12967             :      * older server and then reload into that old version.  This can go away
   12968             :      * once 8.3 is so old as to not be of interest to anyone.
   12969             :      */
   12970           0 :     resetPQExpBuffer(query);
   12971             : 
   12972           0 :     if (fout->remoteVersion >= 90100)
   12973             :     {
   12974           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "SELECT amopstrategy, false AS amopreqcheck, "
   12975             :                           "amopopr::pg_catalog.regoperator, "
   12976             :                           "opfname AS sortfamily, "
   12977             :                           "nspname AS sortfamilynsp "
   12978             :                           "FROM pg_catalog.pg_amop ao JOIN pg_catalog.pg_depend ON "
   12979             :                           "(classid = 'pg_catalog.pg_amop'::pg_catalog.regclass AND objid = ao.oid) "
   12980             :                           "LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_opfamily f ON f.oid = amopsortfamily "
   12981             :                           "LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = opfnamespace "
   12982             :                           "WHERE refclassid = 'pg_catalog.pg_opclass'::pg_catalog.regclass "
   12983             :                           "AND refobjid = '%u'::pg_catalog.oid "
   12984             :                           "AND amopfamily = '%s'::pg_catalog.oid "
   12985             :                           "ORDER BY amopstrategy",
   12986             :                           opcinfo->dobj.catId.oid,
   12987             :                           opcfamily);
   12988             :     }
   12989           0 :     else if (fout->remoteVersion >= 80400)
   12990             :     {
   12991           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "SELECT amopstrategy, false AS amopreqcheck, "
   12992             :                           "amopopr::pg_catalog.regoperator, "
   12993             :                           "NULL AS sortfamily, "
   12994             :                           "NULL AS sortfamilynsp "
   12995             :                           "FROM pg_catalog.pg_amop ao, pg_catalog.pg_depend "
   12996             :                           "WHERE refclassid = 'pg_catalog.pg_opclass'::pg_catalog.regclass "
   12997             :                           "AND refobjid = '%u'::pg_catalog.oid "
   12998             :                           "AND classid = 'pg_catalog.pg_amop'::pg_catalog.regclass "
   12999             :                           "AND objid = ao.oid "
   13000             :                           "ORDER BY amopstrategy",
   13001             :                           opcinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   13002             :     }
   13003           0 :     else if (fout->remoteVersion >= 80300)
   13004             :     {
   13005           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "SELECT amopstrategy, amopreqcheck, "
   13006             :                           "amopopr::pg_catalog.regoperator, "
   13007             :                           "NULL AS sortfamily, "
   13008             :                           "NULL AS sortfamilynsp "
   13009             :                           "FROM pg_catalog.pg_amop ao, pg_catalog.pg_depend "
   13010             :                           "WHERE refclassid = 'pg_catalog.pg_opclass'::pg_catalog.regclass "
   13011             :                           "AND refobjid = '%u'::pg_catalog.oid "
   13012             :                           "AND classid = 'pg_catalog.pg_amop'::pg_catalog.regclass "
   13013             :                           "AND objid = ao.oid "
   13014             :                           "ORDER BY amopstrategy",
   13015             :                           opcinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   13016             :     }

   13018             :     {
   13019             :         /*
   13020             :          * Here, we print all entries since there are no opfamilies and hence
   13021             :          * no loose operators to worry about.
   13022             :          */
   13023           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "SELECT amopstrategy, amopreqcheck, "
   13024             :                           "amopopr::pg_catalog.regoperator, "
   13025             :                           "NULL AS sortfamily, "
   13026             :                           "NULL AS sortfamilynsp "
   13027             :                           "FROM pg_catalog.pg_amop "
   13028             :                           "WHERE amopclaid = '%u'::pg_catalog.oid "
   13029             :                           "ORDER BY amopstrategy",
   13030             :                           opcinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   13031             :     }
   13032             : 
   13033           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQuery(fout, query->data, PGRES_TUPLES_OK);
   13034             : 
   13035           0 :     ntups = PQntuples(res);
   13036             : 
   13037           0 :     i_amopstrategy = PQfnumber(res, "amopstrategy");
   13038           0 :     i_amopreqcheck = PQfnumber(res, "amopreqcheck");

   13040           0 :     i_sortfamily = PQfnumber(res, "sortfamily");
   13041           0 :     i_sortfamilynsp = PQfnumber(res, "sortfamilynsp");
   13042             : 
   13043           0 :     for (i = 0; i < ntups; i++)
   13044             :     {
   13045           0 :         amopstrategy = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_amopstrategy);
   13046           0 :         amopreqcheck = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_amopreqcheck);
   13047           0 :         amopopr = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_amopopr);
   13048           0 :         sortfamily = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_sortfamily);
   13049           0 :         sortfamilynsp = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_sortfamilynsp);
   13050             : 
   13051           0 :         if (needComma)
   13052           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(q, " ,\n    ");
   13053             : 
   13054           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "OPERATOR %s %s",
   13055             :                           amopstrategy, amopopr);
   13056             : 
   13057           0 :         if (strlen(sortfamily) > 0)
   13058             :         {
   13059           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(q, " FOR ORDER BY ");
   13060           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(q, "%s.", fmtId(sortfamilynsp));
   13061           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(q, fmtId(sortfamily));
   13062             :         }
   13063             : 
   13064           0 :         if (strcmp(amopreqcheck, "t") == 0)
   13065           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(q, " RECHECK");
   13066             : 
   13067           0 :         needComma = true;
   13068             :     }
   13069             : 
   13070           0 :     PQclear(res);
   13071             : 
   13072             :     /*
   13073             :      * Now fetch and print the FUNCTION entries (pg_amproc rows).
   13074             :      *
   13075             :      * Print only those opfamily members that are tied to the opclass by
   13076             :      * pg_depend entries.
   13077             :      *
   13078             :      * We print the amproclefttype/amprocrighttype even though in most cases
   13079             :      * the backend could deduce the right values, because of the corner case
   13080             :      * of a btree sort support function for a cross-type comparison.  That's
   13081             :      * only allowed in 9.2 and later, but for simplicity print them in all
   13082             :      * versions that have the columns.
   13083             :      */
   13084           0 :     resetPQExpBuffer(query);
   13085             : 
   13086           0 :     if (fout->remoteVersion >= 80300)
   13087             :     {
   13088           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "SELECT amprocnum, "
   13089             :                           "amproc::pg_catalog.regprocedure, "
   13090             :                           "amproclefttype::pg_catalog.regtype, "
   13091             :                           "amprocrighttype::pg_catalog.regtype "
   13092             :                           "FROM pg_catalog.pg_amproc ap, pg_catalog.pg_depend "
   13093             :                           "WHERE refclassid = 'pg_catalog.pg_opclass'::pg_catalog.regclass "
   13094             :                           "AND refobjid = '%u'::pg_catalog.oid "
   13095             :                           "AND classid = 'pg_catalog.pg_amproc'::pg_catalog.regclass "
   13096             :                           "AND objid = ap.oid "
   13097             :                           "ORDER BY amprocnum",
   13098             :                           opcinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   13099             :     }
   13100             :     else
   13101             :     {
   13102           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "SELECT amprocnum, "
   13103             :                           "amproc::pg_catalog.regprocedure, "
   13104             :                           "'' AS amproclefttype, "
   13105             :                           "'' AS amprocrighttype "
   13106             :                           "FROM pg_catalog.pg_amproc "
   13107             :                           "WHERE amopclaid = '%u'::pg_catalog.oid "
   13108             :                           "ORDER BY amprocnum",
   13109             :                           opcinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   13110             :     }
   13111             : 
   13112           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQuery(fout, query->data, PGRES_TUPLES_OK);
   13113             : 
   13114           0 :     ntups = PQntuples(res);
   13115             : 
   13116           0 :     i_amprocnum = PQfnumber(res, "amprocnum");
   13117           0 :     i_amproc = PQfnumber(res, "amproc");
   13118           0 :     i_amproclefttype = PQfnumber(res, "amproclefttype");
   13119           0 :     i_amprocrighttype = PQfnumber(res, "amprocrighttype");
   13120             : 
   13121           0 :     for (i = 0; i < ntups; i++)
   13122             :     {
   13123           0 :         amprocnum = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_amprocnum);
   13124           0 :         amproc = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_amproc);
   13125           0 :         amproclefttype = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_amproclefttype);
   13126           0 :         amprocrighttype = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_amprocrighttype);
   13127             : 
   13128           0 :         if (needComma)
   13129           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(q, " ,\n    ");
   13130             : 
   13131           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "FUNCTION %s", amprocnum);
   13132             : 
   13133           0 :         if (*amproclefttype && *amprocrighttype)
   13134           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(q, " (%s, %s)", amproclefttype, amprocrighttype);
   13135             : 
   13136           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, " %s", amproc);
   13137             : 
   13138           0 :         needComma = true;
   13139             :     }
   13140             : 
   13141           0 :     PQclear(res);
   13142             : 
   13143             :     /*
   13144             :      * If needComma is still false it means we haven't added anything after
   13145             :      * the AS keyword.  To avoid printing broken SQL, append a dummy STORAGE
   13146             :      * clause with the same datatype.  This isn't sanctioned by the
   13147             :      * documentation, but actually DefineOpClass will treat it as a no-op.
   13148             :      */
   13149           0 :     if (!needComma)
   13150           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "STORAGE %s", opcintype);
   13151             : 
   13152           0 :     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ";\n");
   13153             :

   13239             :     /*
   13240             :      * Fetch only those opfamily members that are tied directly to the
   13241             :      * opfamily by pg_depend entries.
   13242             :      *
   13243             :      * XXX RECHECK is gone as of 8.4, but we'll still print it if dumping an
   13244             :      * older server's opclass in which it is used.  This is to avoid
   13245             :      * hard-to-detect breakage if a newer pg_dump is used to dump from an
   13246             :      * older server and then reload into that old version.  This can go away
   13247             :      * once 8.3 is so old as to not be of interest to anyone.
   13248             :      */

   13250             :     {

   13455             :  * dumpCollation

   13460             : {
   13461           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;

   13468             :     int         i_collisdeterministic;

   13471             :     const char *collprovider;
   13472             :     const char *collcollate;
   13473             :     const char *collctype;
   13474             : 
   13475             :     /* Skip if not to be dumped */
   13476           0 :     if (!collinfo->dobj.dump || dopt->dataOnly)
   13477           0 :         return;
   13478             : 
   13479           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   13480           0 :     q = createPQExpBuffer();
   13481           0 :     delq = createPQExpBuffer();

   13483           0 :     qcollname = pg_strdup(fmtId(collinfo->dobj.name));
   13484             : 
   13485             :     /* Get collation-specific details */
   13486           0 :     appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "SELECT ");
   13487             : 
   13488           0 :     if (fout->remoteVersion >= 100000)
   13489           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(query,
   13490             :                              "collprovider, "
   13491             :                              "collversion, ");
   13492             :     else

   13495             :                              "NULL AS collversion, ");

   13499             :                              "collisdeterministic, ");

   13502             :                              "true AS collisdeterministic, ");

   13506             :                       "collctype "

   13508             :                       "WHERE c.oid = '%u'::pg_catalog.oid",

   13534             :         /* to allow dumping pg_catalog; not accepted on input */

   13605             : /*
   13606             :  * dumpConversion

   13608             :  */
   13609             : static void
   13610           0 : dumpConversion(Archive *fout, ConvInfo *convinfo)
   13611             : {
   13612           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   13613             :     PQExpBuffer query;
   13614             :     PQExpBuffer q;
   13615             :     PQExpBuffer delq;
   13616             :     char       *qconvname;
   13617             :     PGresult   *res;
   13618             :     int         i_conforencoding;
   13619             :     int         i_contoencoding;
   13620             :     int         i_conproc;
   13621             :     int         i_condefault;
   13622             :     const char *conforencoding;
   13623             :     const char *contoencoding;
   13624             :     const char *conproc;
   13625             :     bool        condefault;
   13626             : 
   13627             :     /* Skip if not to be dumped */
   13628           0 :     if (!convinfo->dobj.dump || dopt->dataOnly)
   13629           0 :         return;
   13630             : 
   13631           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   13632           0 :     q = createPQExpBuffer();
   13633           0 :     delq = createPQExpBuffer();
   13634             : 
   13635           0 :     qconvname = pg_strdup(fmtId(convinfo->dobj.name));
   13636             : 
   13637             :     /* Get conversion-specific details */
   13638           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(query, "SELECT "
   13639             :                       "pg_catalog.pg_encoding_to_char(conforencoding) AS conforencoding, "
   13640             :                       "pg_catalog.pg_encoding_to_char(contoencoding) AS contoencoding, "
   13641             :                       "conproc, condefault "
   13642             :                       "FROM pg_catalog.pg_conversion c "
   13643             :                       "WHERE c.oid = '%u'::pg_catalog.oid",
   13644             :                       convinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   13645             : 
   13646           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQueryForSingleRow(fout, query->data);
   13647             : 
   13648           0 :     i_conforencoding = PQfnumber(res, "conforencoding");
   13649           0 :     i_contoencoding = PQfnumber(res, "contoencoding");
   13650           0 :     i_conproc = PQfnumber(res, "conproc");
   13651           0 :     i_condefault = PQfnumber(res, "condefault");

   13653           0 :     conforencoding = PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_conforencoding);
   13654           0 :     contoencoding = PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_contoencoding);
   13655           0 :     conproc = PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_conproc);
   13656           0 :     condefault = (PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_condefault)[0] == 't');
   13657             : 
   13658           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(delq, "DROP CONVERSION %s;\n",
   13659           0 :                       fmtQualifiedDumpable(convinfo));
   13660             : 
   13661           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(q, "CREATE %sCONVERSION %s FOR ",
   13662             :                       (condefault) ? "DEFAULT " : "",
   13663           0 :                       fmtQualifiedDumpable(convinfo));
   13664           0 :     appendStringLiteralAH(q, conforencoding, fout);
   13665           0 :     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, " TO ");
   13666           0 :     appendStringLiteralAH(q, contoencoding, fout);
   13667             :     /* regproc output is already sufficiently quoted */
   13668           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(q, " FROM %s;\n", conproc);

   13670           0 :     if (dopt->binary_upgrade)

   13672             :                                         "CONVERSION", qconvname,
   13673           0 :                                         convinfo->dobj.namespace->dobj.name);

   13698             : 
   13699             : /*
   13700             :  * format_aggregate_signature: generate aggregate name and argument list
   13701             :  *
   13702             :  * The argument type names are qualified if needed.  The aggregate name
   13703             :  * is never qualified.
   13704             :  */
   13705             : static char *
   13706           0 : format_aggregate_signature(AggInfo *agginfo, Archive *fout, bool honor_quotes)
   13707             : {
   13708             :     PQExpBufferData buf;
   13709             :     int         j;
   13710             : 
   13711           0 :     initPQExpBuffer(&buf);
   13712           0 :     if (honor_quotes)
   13713           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(&buf, fmtId(agginfo->aggfn.dobj.name));
   13714             :     else
   13715           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(&buf, agginfo->aggfn.dobj.name);
   13716             : 
   13717           0 :     if (agginfo->aggfn.nargs == 0)
   13718           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(&buf, "(*)");
   13719             :     else
   13720             :     {
   13721           0 :         appendPQExpBufferChar(&buf, '(');
   13722           0 :         for (j = 0; j < agginfo->aggfn.nargs; j++)
   13723             :         {
   13724             :             char       *typname;
   13725             : 
   13726           0 :             typname = getFormattedTypeName(fout, agginfo->aggfn.argtypes[j],
   13727             :                                            zeroAsOpaque);
   13728             : 
   13729           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(&buf, "%s%s",
   13730             :                               (j > 0) ? ", " : "",
   13731             :                               typname);
   13732           0 :             free(typname);
   13733             :         }
   13734           0 :         appendPQExpBufferChar(&buf, ')');
   13735             :     }
   13736           0 :     return buf.data;
   13737             : }
   13738             :

   14019             : 
   14020             :     /* identify default modify flag for aggkind (must match DefineAggregate) */
   14021           0 :     defaultfinalmodify = (aggkind == AGGKIND_NORMAL) ? AGGMODIFY_READ_ONLY : AGGMODIFY_READ_WRITE;

   14418             : /*
   14419             :  * dumpTSConfig
   14420             :  *    write out a single text search configuration
   14421             :  */
   14422             : static void
   14423           0 : dumpTSConfig(Archive *fout, TSConfigInfo *cfginfo)
   14424             : {
   14425           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   14426             :     PQExpBuffer q;
   14427             :     PQExpBuffer delq;
   14428             :     PQExpBuffer query;
   14429             :     char       *qcfgname;
   14430             :     PGresult   *res;
   14431             :     char       *nspname;
   14432             :     char       *prsname;
   14433             :     int         ntups,
   14434             :                 i;
   14435             :     int         i_tokenname;
   14436             :     int         i_dictname;
   14437             : 
   14438             :     /* Skip if not to be dumped */
   14439           0 :     if (!cfginfo->dobj.dump || dopt->dataOnly)
   14440           0 :         return;
   14441             : 
   14442           0 :     q = createPQExpBuffer();
   14443           0 :     delq = createPQExpBuffer();
   14444           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   14445             : 
   14446           0 :     qcfgname = pg_strdup(fmtId(cfginfo->dobj.name));
   14447             : 
   14448             :     /* Fetch name and namespace of the config's parser */
   14449           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(query, "SELECT nspname, prsname "
   14450             :                       "FROM pg_ts_parser p, pg_namespace n "
   14451             :                       "WHERE p.oid = '%u' AND n.oid = prsnamespace",
   14452             :                       cfginfo->cfgparser);
   14453           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQueryForSingleRow(fout, query->data);
   14454           0 :     nspname = PQgetvalue(res, 0, 0);
   14455           0 :     prsname = PQgetvalue(res, 0, 1);
   14456             : 
   14457           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(q, "CREATE TEXT SEARCH CONFIGURATION %s (\n",
   14458           0 :                       fmtQualifiedDumpable(cfginfo));
   14459             : 
   14460           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(q, "    PARSER = %s.", fmtId(nspname));
   14461           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(q, "%s );\n", fmtId(prsname));
   14462             : 
   14463           0 :     PQclear(res);
   14464             : 
   14465           0 :     resetPQExpBuffer(query);
   14466           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(query,
   14467             :                       "SELECT\n"
   14468             :                       "  ( SELECT alias FROM pg_catalog.ts_token_type('%u'::pg_catalog.oid) AS t\n"
   14469             :                       "    WHERE t.tokid = m.maptokentype ) AS tokenname,\n"
   14470             :                       "  m.mapdict::pg_catalog.regdictionary AS dictname\n"
   14471             :                       "FROM pg_catalog.pg_ts_config_map AS m\n"
   14472             :                       "WHERE m.mapcfg = '%u'\n"
   14473             :                       "ORDER BY m.mapcfg, m.maptokentype, m.mapseqno",
   14474             :                       cfginfo->cfgparser, cfginfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   14475             : 
   14476           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQuery(fout, query->data, PGRES_TUPLES_OK);
   14477           0 :     ntups = PQntuples(res);
   14478             : 
   14479           0 :     i_tokenname = PQfnumber(res, "tokenname");
   14480           0 :     i_dictname = PQfnumber(res, "dictname");

   14484           0 :         char       *tokenname = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_tokenname);
   14485           0 :         char       *dictname = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_dictname);

   14488           0 :             strcmp(tokenname, PQgetvalue(res, i - 1, i_tokenname)) != 0)

   14490             :             /* starting a new token type, so start a new command */
   14491           0 :             if (i > 0)
   14492           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ";\n");

   14499             :         else
   14500           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(q, ", %s", dictname);
   14501             :     }
   14502             : 
   14503           0 :     if (ntups > 0)
   14504           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ";\n");

   14507             :

   14509           0 :                       fmtQualifiedDumpable(cfginfo));

   14707             : /*
   14708             :  * dumpUserMappings
   14709             :  *
   14710             :  * This routine is used to dump any user mappings associated with the
   14711             :  * server handed to this routine. Should be called after ArchiveEntry()
   14712             :  * for the server.
   14713             :  */
   14714             : static void
   14715           0 : dumpUserMappings(Archive *fout,
   14716             :                  const char *servername, const char *namespace,
   14717             :                  const char *owner,
   14718             :                  CatalogId catalogId, DumpId dumpId)
   14719             : {
   14720             :     PQExpBuffer q;
   14721             :     PQExpBuffer delq;
   14722             :     PQExpBuffer query;
   14723             :     PQExpBuffer tag;
   14724             :     PGresult   *res;
   14725             :     int         ntups;
   14726             :     int         i_usename;
   14727             :     int         i_umoptions;
   14728             :     int         i;
   14729             : 
   14730           0 :     q = createPQExpBuffer();
   14731           0 :     tag = createPQExpBuffer();
   14732           0 :     delq = createPQExpBuffer();
   14733           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   14734             : 
   14735             :     /*
   14736             :      * We read from the publicly accessible view pg_user_mappings, so as not
   14737             :      * to fail if run by a non-superuser.  Note that the view will show
   14738             :      * umoptions as null if the user hasn't got privileges for the associated
   14739             :      * server; this means that pg_dump will dump such a mapping, but with no
   14740             :      * OPTIONS clause.  A possible alternative is to skip such mappings
   14741             :      * altogether, but it's not clear that that's an improvement.
   14742             :      */
   14743           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(query,
   14744             :                       "SELECT usename, "
   14745             :                       "array_to_string(ARRAY("
   14746             :                       "SELECT quote_ident(option_name) || ' ' || "
   14747             :                       "quote_literal(option_value) "
   14748             :                       "FROM pg_options_to_table(umoptions) "
   14749             :                       "ORDER BY option_name"
   14750             :                       "), E',\n    ') AS umoptions "
   14751             :                       "FROM pg_user_mappings "
   14752             :                       "WHERE srvid = '%u' "
   14753             :                       "ORDER BY usename",
   14754             :                       catalogId.oid);
   14755             : 
   14756           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQuery(fout, query->data, PGRES_TUPLES_OK);
   14757             : 
   14758           0 :     ntups = PQntuples(res);
   14759           0 :     i_usename = PQfnumber(res, "usename");
   14760           0 :     i_umoptions = PQfnumber(res, "umoptions");
   14761             : 
   14762           0 :     for (i = 0; i < ntups; i++)
   14763             :     {
   14764             :         char       *usename;
   14765             :         char       *umoptions;
   14766             : 
   14767           0 :         usename = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_usename);
   14768           0 :         umoptions = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_umoptions);
   14769             : 
   14770           0 :         resetPQExpBuffer(q);
   14771           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "CREATE USER MAPPING FOR %s", fmtId(usename));
   14772           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, " SERVER %s", fmtId(servername));
   14773             : 
   14774           0 :         if (umoptions && strlen(umoptions) > 0)
   14775           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(q, " OPTIONS (\n    %s\n)", umoptions);
   14776             : 
   14777           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ";\n");
   14778             : 
   14779           0 :         resetPQExpBuffer(delq);
   14780           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(delq, "DROP USER MAPPING FOR %s", fmtId(usename));
   14781           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(delq, " SERVER %s;\n", fmtId(servername));
   14782             : 
   14783           0 :         resetPQExpBuffer(tag);
   14784           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(tag, "USER MAPPING %s SERVER %s",
   14785             :                           usename, servername);
   14786             : 
   14787           0 :         ArchiveEntry(fout, nilCatalogId, createDumpId(),
   14788           0 :                      ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = tag->data,
   14789             :                                   .namespace = namespace,
   14790             :                                   .owner = owner,
   14791             :                                   .description = "USER MAPPING",
   14792             :                                   .section = SECTION_PRE_DATA,
   14793             :                                   .createStmt = q->data,
   14794             :                                   .dropStmt = delq->data));
   14795             :     }
   14796             : 
   14797           0 :     PQclear(res);
   14798             : 
   14799           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   14800           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(delq);
   14801           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(tag);
   14802           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(q);
   14803           0 : }
   14804             : 
   14805             : /*
   14806             :  * Write out default privileges information
   14807             :  */
   14808             : static void
   14809           0 : dumpDefaultACL(Archive *fout, DefaultACLInfo *daclinfo)
   14810             : {
   14811           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   14812             :     PQExpBuffer q;
   14813             :     PQExpBuffer tag;
   14814             :     const char *type;
   14815             : 
   14816             :     /* Skip if not to be dumped */
   14817           0 :     if (!daclinfo->dobj.dump || dopt->dataOnly || dopt->aclsSkip)
   14818           0 :         return;
   14819             : 
   14820           0 :     q = createPQExpBuffer();
   14821           0 :     tag = createPQExpBuffer();
   14822             : 
   14823           0 :     switch (daclinfo->defaclobjtype)
   14824             :     {
   14825             :         case DEFACLOBJ_RELATION:
   14826           0 :             type = "TABLES";
   14827           0 :             break;
   14828             :         case DEFACLOBJ_SEQUENCE:
   14829           0 :             type = "SEQUENCES";
   14830           0 :             break;
   14831             :         case DEFACLOBJ_FUNCTION:
   14832           0 :             type = "FUNCTIONS";
   14833           0 :             break;
   14834             :         case DEFACLOBJ_TYPE:
   14835           0 :             type = "TYPES";
   14836           0 :             break;
   14837             :         case DEFACLOBJ_NAMESPACE:
   14838           0 :             type = "SCHEMAS";
   14839           0 :             break;
   14840             :         default:
   14841             :             /* shouldn't get here */
   14842           0 :             fatal("unrecognized object type in default privileges: %d",
   14843             :                   (int) daclinfo->defaclobjtype);
   14844             :             type = "";            /* keep compiler quiet */
   14845             :     }
   14846             : 
   14847           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(tag, "DEFAULT PRIVILEGES FOR %s", type);
   14848             : 
   14849             :     /* build the actual command(s) for this tuple */
   14850           0 :     if (!buildDefaultACLCommands(type,
   14851           0 :                                  daclinfo->dobj.namespace != NULL ?
   14852           0 :                                  daclinfo->dobj.namespace->dobj.name : NULL,
   14853           0 :                                  daclinfo->defaclacl,
   14854           0 :                                  daclinfo->rdefaclacl,
   14855           0 :                                  daclinfo->initdefaclacl,
   14856           0 :                                  daclinfo->initrdefaclacl,
   14857           0 :                                  daclinfo->defaclrole,
   14858             :                                  fout->remoteVersion,
   14859             :                                  q))
   14860           0 :         fatal("could not parse default ACL list (%s)",
   14861             :               daclinfo->defaclacl);
   14862             : 
   14863           0 :     if (daclinfo->dobj.dump & DUMP_COMPONENT_ACL)
   14864           0 :         ArchiveEntry(fout, daclinfo->dobj.catId, daclinfo->dobj.dumpId,
   14865           0 :                      ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = tag->data,
   14866             :                                   .namespace = daclinfo->dobj.namespace ?
   14867             :                                   daclinfo->dobj.namespace->dobj.name : NULL,
   14868             :                                   .owner = daclinfo->defaclrole,
   14869             :                                   .description = "DEFAULT ACL",
   14870             :                                   .section = SECTION_POST_DATA,
   14871             :                                   .createStmt = q->data));
   14872             : 
   14873           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(tag);
   14874           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(q);
   14875             : }
   14876             : 
   14877             : /*----------
   14878             :  * Write out grant/revoke information
   14879             :  *
   14880             :  * 'objCatId' is the catalog ID of the underlying object.
   14881             :  * 'objDumpId' is the dump ID of the underlying object.
   14882             :  * 'type' must be one of
   14883             :  *      TABLE, SEQUENCE, FUNCTION, LANGUAGE, SCHEMA, DATABASE, TABLESPACE,
   14884             :  *      FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER, SERVER, or LARGE OBJECT.
   14885             :  * 'name' is the formatted name of the object.  Must be quoted etc. already.
   14886             :  * 'subname' is the formatted name of the sub-object, if any.  Must be quoted.
   14887             :  *      (Currently we assume that subname is only provided for table columns.)
   14888             :  * 'nspname' is the namespace the object is in (NULL if none).
   14889             :  * 'owner' is the owner, NULL if there is no owner (for languages).
   14890             :  * 'acls' contains the ACL string of the object from the appropriate system
   14891             :  *      catalog field; it will be passed to buildACLCommands for building the
   14892             :  *      appropriate GRANT commands.
   14893             :  * 'racls' contains the ACL string of any initial-but-now-revoked ACLs of the
   14894             :  *      object; it will be passed to buildACLCommands for building the
   14895             :  *      appropriate REVOKE commands.
   14896             :  * 'initacls' In binary-upgrade mode, ACL string of the object's initial
   14897             :  *      privileges, to be recorded into pg_init_privs
   14898             :  * 'initracls' In binary-upgrade mode, ACL string of the object's
   14899             :  *      revoked-from-default privileges, to be recorded into pg_init_privs
   14900             :  *
   14901             :  * NB: initacls/initracls are needed because extensions can set privileges on
   14902             :  * an object during the extension's script file and we record those into
   14903             :  * pg_init_privs as that object's initial privileges.
   14904             :  *----------
   14905             :  */
   14906             : static void
   14907           0 : dumpACL(Archive *fout, CatalogId objCatId, DumpId objDumpId,
   14908             :         const char *type, const char *name, const char *subname,
   14909             :         const char *nspname, const char *owner,
   14910             :         const char *acls, const char *racls,
   14911             :         const char *initacls, const char *initracls)
   14912             : {
   14913           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   14914             :     PQExpBuffer sql;
   14915             : 
   14916             :     /* Do nothing if ACL dump is not enabled */
   14917           0 :     if (dopt->aclsSkip)
   14918           0 :         return;
   14919             : 
   14920             :     /* --data-only skips ACLs *except* BLOB ACLs */
   14921           0 :     if (dopt->dataOnly && strcmp(type, "LARGE OBJECT") != 0)
   14922           0 :         return;
   14923             : 
   14924           0 :     sql = createPQExpBuffer();
   14925             : 
   14926             :     /*
   14927             :      * Check to see if this object has had any initial ACLs included for it.
   14928             :      * If so, we are in binary upgrade mode and these are the ACLs to turn
   14929             :      * into GRANT and REVOKE statements to set and record the initial
   14930             :      * privileges for an extension object.  Let the backend know that these
   14931             :      * are to be recorded by calling binary_upgrade_set_record_init_privs()
   14932             :      * before and after.
   14933             :      */
   14934           0 :     if (strlen(initacls) != 0 || strlen(initracls) != 0)
   14935             :     {
   14936           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(sql, "SELECT pg_catalog.binary_upgrade_set_record_init_privs(true);\n");
   14937           0 :         if (!buildACLCommands(name, subname, nspname, type,
   14938             :                               initacls, initracls, owner,
   14939             :                               "", fout->remoteVersion, sql))
   14940           0 :             fatal("could not parse initial GRANT ACL list (%s) or initial REVOKE ACL list (%s) for object \"%s\" (%s)",
   14941             :                   initacls, initracls, name, type);
   14942           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(sql, "SELECT pg_catalog.binary_upgrade_set_record_init_privs(false);\n");
   14943             :     }
   14944             : 
   14945           0 :     if (!buildACLCommands(name, subname, nspname, type,
   14946             :                           acls, racls, owner,
   14947             :                           "", fout->remoteVersion, sql))
   14948           0 :         fatal("could not parse GRANT ACL list (%s) or REVOKE ACL list (%s) for object \"%s\" (%s)",
   14949             :               acls, racls, name, type);
   14950             : 
   14951           0 :     if (sql->len > 0)
   14952             :     {
   14953           0 :         PQExpBuffer tag = createPQExpBuffer();
   14954             : 
   14955           0 :         if (subname)
   14956           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(tag, "COLUMN %s.%s", name, subname);
   14957             :         else
   14958           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(tag, "%s %s", type, name);
   14959             : 
   14960           0 :         ArchiveEntry(fout, nilCatalogId, createDumpId(),
   14961           0 :                      ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = tag->data,
   14962             :                                   .namespace = nspname,
   14963             :                                   .owner = owner,
   14964             :                                   .description = "ACL",

   14967             :                                   .deps = &objDumpId,
   14968             :                                   .nDeps = 1));
   14969           0 :         destroyPQExpBuffer(tag);
   14970             :     }
   14971             : 
   14972           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(sql);
   14973             : }
   14974             : 
   14975             : /*
   14976             :  * dumpSecLabel
   14977             :  *
   14978             :  * This routine is used to dump any security labels associated with the
   14979             :  * object handed to this routine. The routine takes the object type
   14980             :  * and object name (ready to print, except for schema decoration), plus
   14981             :  * the namespace and owner of the object (for labeling the ArchiveEntry),
   14982             :  * plus catalog ID and subid which are the lookup key for pg_seclabel,
   14983             :  * plus the dump ID for the object (for setting a dependency).
   14984             :  * If a matching pg_seclabel entry is found, it is dumped.
   14985             :  *
   14986             :  * Note: although this routine takes a dumpId for dependency purposes,
   14987             :  * that purpose is just to mark the dependency in the emitted dump file
   14988             :  * for possible future use by pg_restore.  We do NOT use it for determining
   14989             :  * ordering of the label in the dump file, because this routine is called
   14990             :  * after dependency sorting occurs.  This routine should be called just after
   14991             :  * calling ArchiveEntry() for the specified object.
   14992             :  */
   14993             : static void
   14994           0 : dumpSecLabel(Archive *fout, const char *type, const char *name,
   14995             :              const char *namespace, const char *owner,
   14996             :              CatalogId catalogId, int subid, DumpId dumpId)
   14997             : {
   14998           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   14999             :     SecLabelItem *labels;
   15000             :     int         nlabels;
   15001             :     int         i;
   15002             :     PQExpBuffer query;
   15003             : 
   15004             :     /* do nothing, if --no-security-labels is supplied */
   15005           0 :     if (dopt->no_security_labels)
   15006           0 :         return;
   15007             : 
   15008             :     /* Security labels are schema not data ... except blob labels are data */
   15009           0 :     if (strcmp(type, "LARGE OBJECT") != 0)
   15010             :     {
   15011           0 :         if (dopt->dataOnly)
   15012           0 :             return;
   15013             :     }
   15014             :     else
   15015             :     {
   15016             :         /* We do dump blob security labels in binary-upgrade mode */
   15017           0 :         if (dopt->schemaOnly && !dopt->binary_upgrade)
   15018           0 :             return;
   15019             :     }
   15020             : 
   15021             :     /* Search for security labels associated with catalogId, using table */
   15022           0 :     nlabels = findSecLabels(fout, catalogId.tableoid, catalogId.oid, &labels);
   15023             : 
   15024           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   15025             : 
   15026           0 :     for (i = 0; i < nlabels; i++)
   15027             :     {
   15028             :         /*
   15029             :          * Ignore label entries for which the subid doesn't match.
   15030             :          */
   15031           0 :         if (labels[i].objsubid != subid)
   15032           0 :             continue;
   15033             : 
   15034           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query,
   15035             :                           "SECURITY LABEL FOR %s ON %s ",
   15036           0 :                           fmtId(labels[i].provider), type);
   15037           0 :         if (namespace && *namespace)
   15038           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(query, "%s.", fmtId(namespace));
   15039           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "%s IS ", name);
   15040           0 :         appendStringLiteralAH(query, labels[i].label, fout);
   15041           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(query, ";\n");
   15042             :     }
   15043             : 
   15044           0 :     if (query->len > 0)
   15045             :     {
   15046           0 :         PQExpBuffer tag = createPQExpBuffer();
   15047             : 
   15048           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(tag, "%s %s", type, name);
   15049           0 :         ArchiveEntry(fout, nilCatalogId, createDumpId(),
   15050           0 :                      ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = tag->data,
   15051             :                                   .namespace = namespace,
   15052             :                                   .owner = owner,
   15053             :                                   .description = "SECURITY LABEL",
   15054             :                                   .section = SECTION_NONE,
   15055             :                                   .createStmt = query->data,
   15056             :                                   .deps = &dumpId,
   15057             :                                   .nDeps = 1));
   15058           0 :         destroyPQExpBuffer(tag);
   15059             :     }
   15060             : 
   15061           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   15062             : }
   15063             : 
   15064             : /*
   15065             :  * dumpTableSecLabel
   15066             :  *
   15067             :  * As above, but dump security label for both the specified table (or view)
   15068             :  * and its columns.
   15069             :  */
   15070             : static void
   15071           0 : dumpTableSecLabel(Archive *fout, TableInfo *tbinfo, const char *reltypename)
   15072             : {
   15073           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   15074             :     SecLabelItem *labels;
   15075             :     int         nlabels;
   15076             :     int         i;
   15077             :     PQExpBuffer query;
   15078             :     PQExpBuffer target;
   15079             : 
   15080             :     /* do nothing, if --no-security-labels is supplied */
   15081           0 :     if (dopt->no_security_labels)
   15082           0 :         return;
   15083             : 
   15084             :     /* SecLabel are SCHEMA not data */
   15085           0 :     if (dopt->dataOnly)
   15086           0 :         return;
   15087             : 
   15088             :     /* Search for comments associated with relation, using table */
   15089           0 :     nlabels = findSecLabels(fout,
   15090             :                             tbinfo->dobj.catId.tableoid,
   15091             :                             tbinfo->dobj.catId.oid,
   15092             :                             &labels);
   15093             : 
   15094             :     /* If security labels exist, build SECURITY LABEL statements */
   15095           0 :     if (nlabels <= 0)
   15096           0 :         return;
   15097             : 
   15098           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   15099           0 :     target = createPQExpBuffer();
   15100             : 
   15101           0 :     for (i = 0; i < nlabels; i++)

   15103             :         const char *colname;
   15104           0 :         const char *provider = labels[i].provider;

   15106           0 :         int         objsubid = labels[i].objsubid;
   15107             : 
   15108           0 :         resetPQExpBuffer(target);
   15109           0 :         if (objsubid == 0)
   15110             :         {
   15111           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(target, "%s %s", reltypename,
   15112           0 :                               fmtQualifiedDumpable(tbinfo));
   15113             :         }

   15115             :         {
   15116           0 :             colname = getAttrName(objsubid, tbinfo);
   15117             :             /* first fmtXXX result must be consumed before calling again */
   15118           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(target, "COLUMN %s",
   15119           0 :                               fmtQualifiedDumpable(tbinfo));

   15121             :         }

   15123             :                           fmtId(provider), target->data);
   15124           0 :         appendStringLiteralAH(query, label, fout);
   15125           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(query, ";\n");
   15126             :     }
   15127           0 :     if (query->len > 0)
   15128             :     {
   15129           0 :         resetPQExpBuffer(target);
   15130           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(target, "%s %s", reltypename,
   15131           0 :                           fmtId(tbinfo->dobj.name));
   15132           0 :         ArchiveEntry(fout, nilCatalogId, createDumpId(),
   15133           0 :                      ARCHIVE_OPTS(.tag = target->data,
