   15142           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   15143           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(target);
   15144             : }
   15145             : 
   15146             : /*
   15147             :  * findSecLabels
   15148             :  *
   15149             :  * Find the security label(s), if any, associated with the given object.
   15150             :  * All the objsubid values associated with the given classoid/objoid are
   15151             :  * found with one search.
   15152             :  */
   15153             : static int
   15154           0 : findSecLabels(Archive *fout, Oid classoid, Oid objoid, SecLabelItem **items)
   15155             : {
   15156             :     /* static storage for table of security labels */
   15157             :     static SecLabelItem *labels = NULL;
   15158             :     static int  nlabels = -1;
   15159             : 
   15160           0 :     SecLabelItem *middle = NULL;
   15161             :     SecLabelItem *low;
   15162             :     SecLabelItem *high;
   15163             :     int         nmatch;
   15164             : 
   15165             :     /* Get security labels if we didn't already */
   15166           0 :     if (nlabels < 0)
   15167           0 :         nlabels = collectSecLabels(fout, &labels);
   15168             : 
   15169           0 :     if (nlabels <= 0)            /* no labels, so no match is possible */
   15170             :     {
   15171           0 :         *items = NULL;
   15172           0 :         return 0;
   15173             :     }
   15174             : 
   15175             :     /*
   15176             :      * Do binary search to find some item matching the object.
   15177             :      */
   15178           0 :     low = &labels[0];
   15179           0 :     high = &labels[nlabels - 1];
   15180           0 :     while (low <= high)
   15181             :     {
   15182           0 :         middle = low + (high - low) / 2;
   15183             : 
   15184           0 :         if (classoid < middle->classoid)
   15185           0 :             high = middle - 1;
   15186           0 :         else if (classoid > middle->classoid)
   15187           0 :             low = middle + 1;
   15188           0 :         else if (objoid < middle->objoid)
   15189           0 :             high = middle - 1;
   15190           0 :         else if (objoid > middle->objoid)
   15191           0 :             low = middle + 1;
   15192             :         else
   15193           0 :             break;              /* found a match */
   15194             :     }
   15195             : 
   15196           0 :     if (low > high)              /* no matches */
   15197             :     {
   15198           0 :         *items = NULL;
   15199           0 :         return 0;
   15200             :     }
   15201             : 
   15202             :     /*
   15203             :      * Now determine how many items match the object.  The search loop
   15204             :      * invariant still holds: only items between low and high inclusive could
   15205             :      * match.
   15206             :      */
   15207           0 :     nmatch = 1;
   15208           0 :     while (middle > low)
   15209             :     {
   15210           0 :         if (classoid != middle[-1].classoid ||
   15211           0 :             objoid != middle[-1].objoid)
   15212             :             break;
   15213           0 :         middle--;
   15214           0 :         nmatch++;
   15215             :     }
   15216             : 
   15217           0 :     *items = middle;
   15218             : 
   15219           0 :     middle += nmatch;
   15220           0 :     while (middle <= high)
   15221             :     {
   15222           0 :         if (classoid != middle->classoid ||
   15223           0 :             objoid != middle->objoid)
   15224             :             break;
   15225           0 :         middle++;
   15226           0 :         nmatch++;
   15227             :     }
   15228             : 
   15229           0 :     return nmatch;
   15230             : }
   15231             : 
   15232             : /*
   15233             :  * collectSecLabels
   15234             :  *
   15235             :  * Construct a table of all security labels available for database objects.
   15236             :  * It's much faster to pull them all at once.
   15237             :  *
   15238             :  * The table is sorted by classoid/objid/objsubid for speed in lookup.
   15239             :  */
   15240             : static int
   15241           0 : collectSecLabels(Archive *fout, SecLabelItem **items)
   15242             : {
   15243             :     PGresult   *res;
   15244             :     PQExpBuffer query;
   15245             :     int         i_label;
   15246             :     int         i_provider;
   15247             :     int         i_classoid;
   15248             :     int         i_objoid;
   15249             :     int         i_objsubid;
   15250             :     int         ntups;
   15251             :     int         i;
   15252             :     SecLabelItem *labels;
   15253             : 
   15254           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   15255             : 
   15256           0 :     appendPQExpBufferStr(query,
   15257             :                          "SELECT label, provider, classoid, objoid, objsubid "
   15258             :                          "FROM pg_catalog.pg_seclabel "
   15259             :                          "ORDER BY classoid, objoid, objsubid");
   15260             : 
   15261           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQuery(fout, query->data, PGRES_TUPLES_OK);
   15262             : 
   15263             :     /* Construct lookup table containing OIDs in numeric form */
   15264           0 :     i_label = PQfnumber(res, "label");
   15265           0 :     i_provider = PQfnumber(res, "provider");
   15266           0 :     i_classoid = PQfnumber(res, "classoid");
   15267           0 :     i_objoid = PQfnumber(res, "objoid");
   15268           0 :     i_objsubid = PQfnumber(res, "objsubid");
   15269             : 
   15270           0 :     ntups = PQntuples(res);
   15271             : 
   15272           0 :     labels = (SecLabelItem *) pg_malloc(ntups * sizeof(SecLabelItem));
   15273             : 
   15274           0 :     for (i = 0; i < ntups; i++)
   15275             :     {
   15276           0 :         labels[i].label = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_label);
   15277           0 :         labels[i].provider = PQgetvalue(res, i, i_provider);
   15278           0 :         labels[i].classoid = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_classoid));
   15279           0 :         labels[i].objoid = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_objoid));
   15280           0 :         labels[i].objsubid = atoi(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_objsubid));
   15281             :     }
   15282             : 
   15283             :     /* Do NOT free the PGresult since we are keeping pointers into it */
   15284           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   15285             : 
   15286           0 :     *items = labels;
   15287           0 :     return ntups;
   15288             : }
   15289             : 
   15290             : /*
   15291             :  * dumpTable
   15292             :  *    write out to fout the declarations (not data) of a user-defined table
   15293             :  */
   15294             : static void
   15295           0 : dumpTable(Archive *fout, TableInfo *tbinfo)
   15296             : {
   15297           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   15298             :     char       *namecopy;
   15299             : 
   15300             :     /*
   15301             :      * noop if we are not dumping anything about this table, or if we are
   15302             :      * doing a data-only dump
   15303             :      */
   15304           0 :     if (!tbinfo->dobj.dump || dopt->dataOnly)
   15305           0 :         return;
   15306             : 
   15307           0 :     if (tbinfo->relkind == RELKIND_SEQUENCE)
   15308           0 :         dumpSequence(fout, tbinfo);
   15309             :     else
   15310           0 :         dumpTableSchema(fout, tbinfo);
   15311             : 
   15312             :     /* Handle the ACL here */
   15313           0 :     namecopy = pg_strdup(fmtId(tbinfo->dobj.name));
   15314           0 :     if (tbinfo->dobj.dump & DUMP_COMPONENT_ACL)
   15315             :     {
   15316           0 :         const char *objtype =
   15317           0 :         (tbinfo->relkind == RELKIND_SEQUENCE) ? "SEQUENCE" : "TABLE";
   15318             : 
   15319           0 :         dumpACL(fout, tbinfo->dobj.catId, tbinfo->dobj.dumpId,
   15320             :                 objtype, namecopy, NULL,
   15321           0 :                 tbinfo->dobj.namespace->dobj.name, tbinfo->rolname,
   15322           0 :                 tbinfo->relacl, tbinfo->rrelacl,
   15323           0 :                 tbinfo->initrelacl, tbinfo->initrrelacl);
   15324             :     }
   15325             : 
   15326             :     /*
   15327             :      * Handle column ACLs, if any.  Note: we pull these with a separate query
   15328             :      * rather than trying to fetch them during getTableAttrs, so that we won't
   15329             :      * miss ACLs on system columns.
   15330             :      */
   15331           0 :     if (fout->remoteVersion >= 80400 && tbinfo->dobj.dump & DUMP_COMPONENT_ACL)
   15332             :     {
   15333           0 :         PQExpBuffer query = createPQExpBuffer();
   15334             :         PGresult   *res;
   15335             :         int         i;
   15336             : 
   15337           0 :         if (fout->remoteVersion >= 90600)
   15338             :         {
   15339           0 :             PQExpBuffer acl_subquery = createPQExpBuffer();
   15340           0 :             PQExpBuffer racl_subquery = createPQExpBuffer();
   15341           0 :             PQExpBuffer initacl_subquery = createPQExpBuffer();
   15342           0 :             PQExpBuffer initracl_subquery = createPQExpBuffer();
   15343             : 
   15344           0 :             buildACLQueries(acl_subquery, racl_subquery, initacl_subquery,
   15345             :                             initracl_subquery, "at.attacl", "c.relowner", "'c'",
   15346           0 :                             dopt->binary_upgrade);
   15347             : 
   15348           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(query,
   15349             :                               "SELECT at.attname, "
   15350             :                               "%s AS attacl, "
   15351             :                               "%s AS rattacl, "
   15352             :                               "%s AS initattacl, "
   15353             :                               "%s AS initrattacl "
   15354             :                               "FROM pg_catalog.pg_attribute at "
   15355             :                               "JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON (at.attrelid = c.oid) "
   15356             :                               "LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_init_privs pip ON "
   15357             :                               "(at.attrelid = pip.objoid "
   15358             :                               "AND pip.classoid = 'pg_catalog.pg_class'::pg_catalog.regclass "
   15359             :                               "AND at.attnum = pip.objsubid) "
   15360             :                               "WHERE at.attrelid = '%u'::pg_catalog.oid AND "
   15361             :                               "NOT at.attisdropped "
   15362             :                               "AND ("
   15363             :                               "%s IS NOT NULL OR "
   15364             :                               "%s IS NOT NULL OR "
   15365             :                               "%s IS NOT NULL OR "
   15366             :                               "%s IS NOT NULL)"
   15367             :                               "ORDER BY at.attnum",
   15368             :                               acl_subquery->data,
   15369             :                               racl_subquery->data,
   15370             :                               initacl_subquery->data,
   15371             :                               initracl_subquery->data,
   15372             :                               tbinfo->dobj.catId.oid,
   15373             :                               acl_subquery->data,
   15374             :                               racl_subquery->data,
   15375             :                               initacl_subquery->data,
   15376             :                               initracl_subquery->data);
   15377             : 
   15378           0 :             destroyPQExpBuffer(acl_subquery);
   15379           0 :             destroyPQExpBuffer(racl_subquery);
   15380           0 :             destroyPQExpBuffer(initacl_subquery);
   15381           0 :             destroyPQExpBuffer(initracl_subquery);
   15382             :         }
   15383             :         else
   15384             :         {
   15385           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(query,
   15386             :                               "SELECT attname, attacl, NULL as rattacl, "
   15387             :                               "NULL AS initattacl, NULL AS initrattacl "
   15388             :                               "FROM pg_catalog.pg_attribute "
   15389             :                               "WHERE attrelid = '%u'::pg_catalog.oid AND NOT attisdropped "
   15390             :                               "AND attacl IS NOT NULL "
   15391             :                               "ORDER BY attnum",
   15392             :                               tbinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   15393             :         }
   15394             : 
   15395           0 :         res = ExecuteSqlQuery(fout, query->data, PGRES_TUPLES_OK);
   15396             : 
   15397           0 :         for (i = 0; i < PQntuples(res); i++)
   15398             :         {
   15399           0 :             char       *attname = PQgetvalue(res, i, 0);
   15400           0 :             char       *attacl = PQgetvalue(res, i, 1);
   15401           0 :             char       *rattacl = PQgetvalue(res, i, 2);
   15402           0 :             char       *initattacl = PQgetvalue(res, i, 3);
   15403           0 :             char       *initrattacl = PQgetvalue(res, i, 4);
   15404             :             char       *attnamecopy;
   15405             : 
   15406           0 :             attnamecopy = pg_strdup(fmtId(attname));
   15407             :             /* Column's GRANT type is always TABLE */
   15408           0 :             dumpACL(fout, tbinfo->dobj.catId, tbinfo->dobj.dumpId,
   15409             :                     "TABLE", namecopy, attnamecopy,
   15410           0 :                     tbinfo->dobj.namespace->dobj.name, tbinfo->rolname,
   15411             :                     attacl, rattacl, initattacl, initrattacl);
   15412           0 :             free(attnamecopy);
   15413             :         }
   15414           0 :         PQclear(res);
   15415           0 :         destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   15416             :     }
   15417             : 
   15418           0 :     free(namecopy);
   15419             : 
   15420           0 :     return;
   15421             : }
   15422             : 
   15423             : /*
   15424             :  * Create the AS clause for a view or materialized view. The semicolon is
   15425             :  * stripped because a materialized view must add a WITH NO DATA clause.
   15426             :  *
   15427             :  * This returns a new buffer which must be freed by the caller.
   15428             :  */
   15429             : static PQExpBuffer
   15430           0 : createViewAsClause(Archive *fout, TableInfo *tbinfo)
   15431             : {
   15432           0 :     PQExpBuffer query = createPQExpBuffer();
   15433           0 :     PQExpBuffer result = createPQExpBuffer();
   15434             :     PGresult   *res;
   15435             :     int         len;
   15436             : 
   15437             :     /* Fetch the view definition */
   15438           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(query,
   15439             :                       "SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_viewdef('%u'::pg_catalog.oid) AS viewdef",
   15440             :                       tbinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   15441             : 
   15442           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQuery(fout, query->data, PGRES_TUPLES_OK);
   15443             : 
   15444           0 :     if (PQntuples(res) != 1)
   15445             :     {
   15446           0 :         if (PQntuples(res) < 1)
   15447           0 :             fatal("query to obtain definition of view \"%s\" returned no data",
   15448             :                   tbinfo->dobj.name);
   15449             :         else
   15450           0 :             fatal("query to obtain definition of view \"%s\" returned more than one definition",
   15451             :                   tbinfo->dobj.name);
   15452             :     }
   15453             : 
   15454           0 :     len = PQgetlength(res, 0, 0);
   15455             : 
   15456           0 :     if (len == 0)
   15457           0 :         fatal("definition of view \"%s\" appears to be empty (length zero)",
   15458             :               tbinfo->dobj.name);
   15459             : 
   15460             :     /* Strip off the trailing semicolon so that other things may follow. */
   15461           0 :     Assert(PQgetvalue(res, 0, 0)[len - 1] == ';');
   15462           0 :     appendBinaryPQExpBuffer(result, PQgetvalue(res, 0, 0), len - 1);
   15463             : 
   15464           0 :     PQclear(res);
   15465           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   15466             : 
   15467           0 :     return result;
   15468             : }
   15469             : 
   15470             : /*
   15471             :  * Create a dummy AS clause for a view.  This is used when the real view
   15472             :  * definition has to be postponed because of circular dependencies.
   15473             :  * We must duplicate the view's external properties -- column names and types
   15474             :  * (including collation) -- so that it works for subsequent references.
   15475             :  *
   15476             :  * This returns a new buffer which must be freed by the caller.
   15477             :  */
   15478             : static PQExpBuffer
   15479           0 : createDummyViewAsClause(Archive *fout, TableInfo *tbinfo)
   15480             : {
   15481           0 :     PQExpBuffer result = createPQExpBuffer();
   15482             :     int         j;
   15483             : 
   15484           0 :     appendPQExpBufferStr(result, "SELECT");
   15485             : 
   15486           0 :     for (j = 0; j < tbinfo->numatts; j++)
   15487             :     {
   15488           0 :         if (j > 0)
   15489           0 :             appendPQExpBufferChar(result, ',');
   15490           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(result, "\n    ");
   15491             : 
   15492           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(result, "NULL::%s", tbinfo->atttypnames[j]);
   15493             : 
   15494             :         /*
   15495             :          * Must add collation if not default for the type, because CREATE OR
   15496             :          * REPLACE VIEW won't change it
   15497             :          */
   15498           0 :         if (OidIsValid(tbinfo->attcollation[j]))
   15499             :         {
   15500             :             CollInfo   *coll;
   15501             : 
   15502           0 :             coll = findCollationByOid(tbinfo->attcollation[j]);
   15503           0 :             if (coll)
   15504           0 :                 appendPQExpBuffer(result, " COLLATE %s",
   15505           0 :                                   fmtQualifiedDumpable(coll));
   15506             :         }
   15507             : 
   15508           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(result, " AS %s", fmtId(tbinfo->attnames[j]));
   15509             :     }
   15510             : 
   15511           0 :     return result;
   15512             : }
   15513             : 
   15514             : /*
   15515             :  * dumpTableSchema
   15516             :  *    write the declaration (not data) of one user-defined table or view
   15517             :  */
   15518             : static void
   15519           0 : dumpTableSchema(Archive *fout, TableInfo *tbinfo)
   15520             : {
   15521           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   15522           0 :     PQExpBuffer q = createPQExpBuffer();
   15523           0 :     PQExpBuffer delq = createPQExpBuffer();
   15524             :     char       *qrelname;
   15525             :     char       *qualrelname;
   15526             :     int         numParents;
   15527             :     TableInfo **parents;
   15528             :     int         actual_atts;    /* number of attrs in this CREATE statement */
   15529             :     const char *reltypename;
   15530             :     char       *storage;
   15531             :     int         j,
   15532             :                 k;
   15533             : 
   15534           0 :     qrelname = pg_strdup(fmtId(tbinfo->dobj.name));
   15535           0 :     qualrelname = pg_strdup(fmtQualifiedDumpable(tbinfo));
   15536             : 
   15537             : 
   15538           0 :     if (tbinfo->hasoids)
   15539           0 :         pg_log_warning("WITH OIDS is not supported anymore (table \"%s\")",
   15540             :                        qrelname);
   15541             : 
   15542           0 :     if (dopt->binary_upgrade)
   15543           0 :         binary_upgrade_set_type_oids_by_rel_oid(fout, q,
   15544             :                                                 tbinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   15545             : 
   15546             :     /* Is it a table or a view? */
   15547           0 :     if (tbinfo->relkind == RELKIND_VIEW)
   15548             :     {
   15549             :         PQExpBuffer result;
   15550             : 
   15551             :         /*
   15552             :          * Note: keep this code in sync with the is_view case in dumpRule()
   15553             :          */
   15554             : 
   15555           0 :         reltypename = "VIEW";
   15556             : 
   15557           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(delq, "DROP VIEW %s;\n", qualrelname);
   15558             : 
   15559           0 :         if (dopt->binary_upgrade)
   15560           0 :             binary_upgrade_set_pg_class_oids(fout, q,
   15561             :                                              tbinfo->dobj.catId.oid, false);
   15562             : 
   15563           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "CREATE VIEW %s", qualrelname);
   15564             : 
   15565           0 :         if (tbinfo->dummy_view)
   15566           0 :             result = createDummyViewAsClause(fout, tbinfo);
   15567             :         else
   15568             :         {
   15569           0 :             if (nonemptyReloptions(tbinfo->reloptions))
   15570             :             {
   15571           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(q, " WITH (");
   15572           0 :                 appendReloptionsArrayAH(q, tbinfo->reloptions, "", fout);
   15573           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferChar(q, ')');
   15574             :             }
   15575           0 :             result = createViewAsClause(fout, tbinfo);
   15576             :         }
   15577           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, " AS\n%s", result->data);
   15578           0 :         destroyPQExpBuffer(result);
   15579             : 
   15580           0 :         if (tbinfo->checkoption != NULL && !tbinfo->dummy_view)
   15581           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(q, "\n  WITH %s CHECK OPTION", tbinfo->checkoption);
   15582           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ";\n");
   15583             :     }
   15584             :     else
   15585             :     {
   15586           0 :         char       *ftoptions = NULL;
   15587           0 :         char       *srvname = NULL;
   15588             : 
   15589           0 :         switch (tbinfo->relkind)
   15590             :         {
   15591             :             case RELKIND_FOREIGN_TABLE:
   15592             :                 {
   15593           0 :                     PQExpBuffer query = createPQExpBuffer();
   15594             :                     PGresult   *res;
   15595             :                     int         i_srvname;
   15596             :                     int         i_ftoptions;
   15597             : 
   15598           0 :                     reltypename = "FOREIGN TABLE";
   15599             : 
   15600             :                     /* retrieve name of foreign server and generic options */
   15601           0 :                     appendPQExpBuffer(query,
   15602             :                                       "SELECT fs.srvname, "
   15603             :                                       "pg_catalog.array_to_string(ARRAY("
   15604             :                                       "SELECT pg_catalog.quote_ident(option_name) || "
   15605             :                                       "' ' || pg_catalog.quote_literal(option_value) "
   15606             :                                       "FROM pg_catalog.pg_options_to_table(ftoptions) "
   15607             :                                       "ORDER BY option_name"
   15608             :                                       "), E',\n    ') AS ftoptions "
   15609             :                                       "FROM pg_catalog.pg_foreign_table ft "
   15610             :                                       "JOIN pg_catalog.pg_foreign_server fs "
   15611             :                                       "ON (fs.oid = ft.ftserver) "
   15612             :                                       "WHERE ft.ftrelid = '%u'",
   15613             :                                       tbinfo->dobj.catId.oid);
   15614           0 :                     res = ExecuteSqlQueryForSingleRow(fout, query->data);
   15615           0 :                     i_srvname = PQfnumber(res, "srvname");

   15618           0 :                     ftoptions = pg_strdup(PQgetvalue(res, 0, i_ftoptions));
   15619           0 :                     PQclear(res);
   15620           0 :                     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   15621           0 :                     break;
   15622             :                 }
   15623             :             case RELKIND_MATVIEW:
   15624           0 :                 reltypename = "MATERIALIZED VIEW";
   15625           0 :                 break;
   15626             :             default:
   15627           0 :                 reltypename = "TABLE";
   15628             :         }
   15629             : 
   15630           0 :         numParents = tbinfo->numParents;
   15631           0 :         parents = tbinfo->parents;
   15632             : 
   15633           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(delq, "DROP %s %s;\n", reltypename, qualrelname);
   15634             : 
   15635           0 :         if (dopt->binary_upgrade)
   15636           0 :             binary_upgrade_set_pg_class_oids(fout, q,
   15637             :                                              tbinfo->dobj.catId.oid, false);
   15638             : 
   15639           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "CREATE %s%s %s",
   15640           0 :                           tbinfo->relpersistence == RELPERSISTENCE_UNLOGGED ?
   15641             :                           "UNLOGGED " : "",
   15642             :                           reltypename,
   15643             :                           qualrelname);
   15644             : 
   15645             :         /*
   15646             :          * Attach to type, if reloftype; except in case of a binary upgrade,
   15647             :          * we dump the table normally and attach it to the type afterward.
   15648             :          */
   15649           0 :         if (tbinfo->reloftype && !dopt->binary_upgrade)
   15650           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(q, " OF %s", tbinfo->reloftype);
   15651             : 
   15652           0 :         if (tbinfo->relkind != RELKIND_MATVIEW)
   15653             :         {
   15654             :             /* Dump the attributes */
   15655           0 :             actual_atts = 0;
   15656           0 :             for (j = 0; j < tbinfo->numatts; j++)
   15657             :             {
   15658             :                 /*
   15659             :                  * Normally, dump if it's locally defined in this table, and
   15660             :                  * not dropped.  But for binary upgrade, we'll dump all the
   15661             :                  * columns, and then fix up the dropped and nonlocal cases
   15662             :                  * below.
   15663             :                  */
   15664           0 :                 if (shouldPrintColumn(dopt, tbinfo, j))
   15665             :                 {
   15666             :                     bool        print_default;
   15667             :                     bool        print_notnull;
   15668             : 
   15669             :                     /*
   15670             :                      * Default value --- suppress if to be printed separately.
   15671             :                      */
   15672           0 :                     print_default = (tbinfo->attrdefs[j] != NULL &&
   15673           0 :                                      !tbinfo->attrdefs[j]->separate);

   15678             :                      * won't work.

   15681           0 :                                      (!tbinfo->inhNotNull[j] ||

   15684             :                     /*
   15685             :                      * Skip column if fully defined by reloftype, except in
   15686             :                      * binary upgrade
   15687             :                      */

   15690           0 :                         continue;
   15691             : 
   15692             :                     /* Format properly if not first attr */

   15696           0 :                         appendPQExpBufferChar(q, ',');
   15697           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "\n    ");
   15698           0 :                     actual_atts++;
   15699             : 
   15700             :                     /* Attribute name */

   15702             : 
   15703           0 :                     if (tbinfo->attisdropped[j])
   15704             :                     {

   15713           0 :                         continue;
   15714             :                     }

   15722             :                     {

   15732             :                         else
   15733           0 :                             appendPQExpBuffer(q, " DEFAULT %s",
   15734           0 :                                               tbinfo->attrdefs[j]->adef_expr);
   15735             :                     }
   15736             : 
   15737             : 
   15738           0 :                     if (print_notnull)
   15739           0 :                         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, " NOT NULL");
   15740             : 
   15741             :                     /* Add collation if not default for the type */
   15742           0 :                     if (OidIsValid(tbinfo->attcollation[j]))
   15743             :                     {
   15744             :                         CollInfo   *coll;
   15745             : 
   15746           0 :                         coll = findCollationByOid(tbinfo->attcollation[j]);

   15748           0 :                             appendPQExpBuffer(q, " COLLATE %s",
   15749           0 :                                               fmtQualifiedDumpable(coll));
   15750             :                     }
   15751             :                 }
   15752             :             }
   15753             : 
   15754             :             /*
   15755             :              * Add non-inherited CHECK constraints, if any.
   15756             :              *
   15757             :              * For partitions, we need to include check constraints even if
   15758             :              * they're not defined locally, because the ALTER TABLE ATTACH
   15759             :              * PARTITION that we'll emit later expects the constraint to be
   15760             :              * there.  (No need to fix conislocal: ATTACH PARTITION does that)
   15761             :              */
   15762           0 :             for (j = 0; j < tbinfo->ncheck; j++)
   15763             :             {
   15764           0 :                 ConstraintInfo *constr = &(tbinfo->checkexprs[j]);
   15765             : 
   15766           0 :                 if (constr->separate ||
   15767           0 :                     (!constr->conislocal && !tbinfo->ispartition))
   15768           0 :                     continue;
   15769             : 
   15770           0 :                 if (actual_atts == 0)
   15771           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, " (\n    ");
   15772             :                 else
   15773           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ",\n    ");
   15774             : 
   15775           0 :                 appendPQExpBuffer(q, "CONSTRAINT %s ",
   15776           0 :                                   fmtId(constr->dobj.name));
   15777           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(q, constr->condef);
   15778             : 
   15779           0 :                 actual_atts++;
   15780             :             }
   15781             : 
   15782           0 :             if (actual_atts)
   15783           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "\n)");
   15784           0 :             else if (!(tbinfo->reloftype && !dopt->binary_upgrade))
   15785             :             {
   15786             :                 /*
   15787             :                  * No attributes? we must have a parenthesized attribute list,
   15788             :                  * even though empty, when not using the OF TYPE syntax.
   15789             :                  */
   15790           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(q, " (\n)");
   15791             :             }
   15792             : 
   15793             :             /*
   15794             :              * Emit the INHERITS clause (not for partitions), except in
   15795             :              * binary-upgrade mode.
   15796             :              */
   15797           0 :             if (numParents > 0 && !tbinfo->ispartition &&
   15798           0 :                 !dopt->binary_upgrade)
   15799             :             {
   15800           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "\nINHERITS (");
   15801           0 :                 for (k = 0; k < numParents; k++)
   15802             :                 {
   15803           0 :                     TableInfo  *parentRel = parents[k];
   15804             : 
   15805           0 :                     if (k > 0)
   15806           0 :                         appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ", ");
   15807           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, fmtQualifiedDumpable(parentRel));
   15808             :                 }
   15809           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferChar(q, ')');
   15810             :             }
   15811             : 
   15812           0 :             if (tbinfo->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE)
   15813           0 :                 appendPQExpBuffer(q, "\nPARTITION BY %s", tbinfo->partkeydef);
   15814             : 
   15815           0 :             if (tbinfo->relkind == RELKIND_FOREIGN_TABLE)
   15816           0 :                 appendPQExpBuffer(q, "\nSERVER %s", fmtId(srvname));
   15817             :         }
   15818             : 
   15819           0 :         if (nonemptyReloptions(tbinfo->reloptions) ||
   15820           0 :             nonemptyReloptions(tbinfo->toast_reloptions))
   15821             :         {
   15822           0 :             bool        addcomma = false;
   15823             : 
   15824           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "\nWITH (");
   15825           0 :             if (nonemptyReloptions(tbinfo->reloptions))
   15826             :             {
   15827           0 :                 addcomma = true;
   15828           0 :                 appendReloptionsArrayAH(q, tbinfo->reloptions, "", fout);
   15829             :             }
   15830           0 :             if (nonemptyReloptions(tbinfo->toast_reloptions))
   15831             :             {
   15832           0 :                 if (addcomma)
   15833           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ", ");
   15834           0 :                 appendReloptionsArrayAH(q, tbinfo->toast_reloptions, "toast.",
   15835             :                                         fout);
   15836             :             }
   15837           0 :             appendPQExpBufferChar(q, ')');
   15838             :         }
   15839             : 
   15840             :         /* Dump generic options if any */
   15841           0 :         if (ftoptions && ftoptions[0])
   15842           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(q, "\nOPTIONS (\n    %s\n)", ftoptions);
   15843             : 
   15844             :         /*
   15845             :          * For materialized views, create the AS clause just like a view. At
   15846             :          * this point, we always mark the view as not populated.
   15847             :          */
   15848           0 :         if (tbinfo->relkind == RELKIND_MATVIEW)
   15849             :         {
   15850             :             PQExpBuffer result;
   15851             : 
   15852           0 :             result = createViewAsClause(fout, tbinfo);
   15853           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(q, " AS\n%s\n  WITH NO DATA;\n",
   15854             :                               result->data);
   15855           0 :             destroyPQExpBuffer(result);
   15856             :         }
   15857             :         else
   15858           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ";\n");
   15859             : 
   15860             :         /*
   15861             :          * in binary upgrade mode, update the catalog with any missing values
   15862             :          * that might be present.
   15863             :          */
   15864           0 :         if (dopt->binary_upgrade)
   15865             :         {
   15866           0 :             for (j = 0; j < tbinfo->numatts; j++)
   15867             :             {
   15868           0 :                 if (tbinfo->attmissingval[j][0] != '\0')
   15869             :                 {
   15870           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "\n-- set missing value.\n");
   15871           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q,
   15872             :                                          "SELECT pg_catalog.binary_upgrade_set_missing_value(");
   15873           0 :                     appendStringLiteralAH(q, qualrelname, fout);
   15874           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "::pg_catalog.regclass,");
   15875           0 :                     appendStringLiteralAH(q, tbinfo->attnames[j], fout);
   15876           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ",");
   15877           0 :                     appendStringLiteralAH(q, tbinfo->attmissingval[j], fout);
   15878           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, ");\n\n");
   15879             :                 }
   15880             :             }
   15881             :         }
   15882             : 
   15883             :         /*
   15884             :          * To create binary-compatible heap files, we have to ensure the same
   15885             :          * physical column order, including dropped columns, as in the
   15886             :          * original.  Therefore, we create dropped columns above and drop them
   15887             :          * here, also updating their attlen/attalign values so that the
   15888             :          * dropped column can be skipped properly.  (We do not bother with
   15889             :          * restoring the original attbyval setting.)  Also, inheritance
   15890             :          * relationships are set up by doing ALTER TABLE INHERIT rather than
   15891             :          * using an INHERITS clause --- the latter would possibly mess up the
   15892             :          * column order.  That also means we have to take care about setting
   15893             :          * attislocal correctly, plus fix up any inherited CHECK constraints.
   15894             :          * Analogously, we set up typed tables using ALTER TABLE / OF here.
   15895             :          *
   15896             :          * We process foreign and partitioned tables here, even though they
   15897             :          * lack heap storage, because they can participate in inheritance
   15898             :          * relationships and we want this stuff to be consistent across the
   15899             :          * inheritance tree.  We can exclude indexes, toast tables, sequences
   15900             :          * and matviews, even though they have storage, because we don't
   15901             :          * support altering or dropping columns in them, nor can they be part
   15902             :          * of inheritance trees.
   15903             :          */
   15904           0 :         if (dopt->binary_upgrade &&
   15905           0 :             (tbinfo->relkind == RELKIND_RELATION ||
   15906           0 :              tbinfo->relkind == RELKIND_FOREIGN_TABLE ||
   15907           0 :              tbinfo->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE))
   15908             :         {
   15909           0 :             for (j = 0; j < tbinfo->numatts; j++)
   15910             :             {
   15911           0 :                 if (tbinfo->attisdropped[j])
   15912             :                 {
   15913           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "\n-- For binary upgrade, recreate dropped column.\n");
   15914           0 :                     appendPQExpBuffer(q, "UPDATE pg_catalog.pg_attribute\n"
   15915             :                                       "SET attlen = %d, "
   15916             :                                       "attalign = '%c', attbyval = false\n"
   15917             :                                       "WHERE attname = ",
   15918           0 :                                       tbinfo->attlen[j],
   15919           0 :                                       tbinfo->attalign[j]);
   15920           0 :                     appendStringLiteralAH(q, tbinfo->attnames[j], fout);
   15921           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "\n  AND attrelid = ");
   15922           0 :                     appendStringLiteralAH(q, qualrelname, fout);
   15923           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "::pg_catalog.regclass;\n");
   15924             : 
   15925           0 :                     if (tbinfo->relkind == RELKIND_RELATION ||
   15926           0 :                         tbinfo->relkind == RELKIND_PARTITIONED_TABLE)
   15927           0 :                         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "ALTER TABLE ONLY %s ",
   15928             :                                           qualrelname);
   15929             :                     else
   15930           0 :                         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "ALTER FOREIGN TABLE ONLY %s ",
   15931             :                                           qualrelname);
   15932           0 :                     appendPQExpBuffer(q, "DROP COLUMN %s;\n",
   15933           0 :                                       fmtId(tbinfo->attnames[j]));
   15934             :                 }
   15935           0 :                 else if (!tbinfo->attislocal[j])
   15936             :                 {
   15937           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "\n-- For binary upgrade, recreate inherited column.\n");
   15938           0 :                     appendPQExpBufferStr(q, "UPDATE pg_catalog.pg_attribute\n"
   15939             :                                          "SET attislocal = false\n"

   15946             :             }

   16263             : /*
   16264             :  * dumpAttrDef --- dump an attribute's default-value declaration
   16265             :  */
   16266             : static void
   16267           0 : dumpAttrDef(Archive *fout, AttrDefInfo *adinfo)
   16268             : {
   16269           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;

   16275             :     char       *tag;
   16276             : 
   16277             :     /* Skip if table definition not to be dumped */
   16278           0 :     if (!tbinfo->dobj.dump || dopt->dataOnly)
   16279           0 :         return;
   16280             : 
   16281             :     /* Skip if not "separate"; it was dumped in the table's definition */
   16282           0 :     if (!adinfo->separate)
   16283           0 :         return;

   16286           0 :     delq = createPQExpBuffer();

   16289             :

   16291             :                       qualrelname);

   16319             : /*
   16320             :  * getAttrName: extract the correct name for an attribute
   16321             :  *
   16322             :  * The array tblInfo->attnames[] only provides names of user attributes;
   16323             :  * if a system attribute number is supplied, we have to fake it.
   16324             :  * We also do a little bit of bounds checking for safety's sake.
   16325             :  */
   16326             : static const char *
   16327           0 : getAttrName(int attrnum, TableInfo *tblInfo)
   16328             : {
   16329           0 :     if (attrnum > 0 && attrnum <= tblInfo->numatts)
   16330           0 :         return tblInfo->attnames[attrnum - 1];
   16331           0 :     switch (attrnum)
   16332             :     {
   16333             :         case SelfItemPointerAttributeNumber:
   16334           0 :             return "ctid";
   16335             :         case MinTransactionIdAttributeNumber:
   16336           0 :             return "xmin";
   16337             :         case MinCommandIdAttributeNumber:
   16338           0 :             return "cmin";
   16339             :         case MaxTransactionIdAttributeNumber:
   16340           0 :             return "xmax";
   16341             :         case MaxCommandIdAttributeNumber:
   16342           0 :             return "cmax";
   16343             :         case TableOidAttributeNumber:
   16344           0 :             return "tableoid";
   16345             :     }
   16346           0 :     fatal("invalid column number %d for table \"%s\"",
   16347             :           attrnum, tblInfo->dobj.name);
   16348             :     return NULL;                /* keep compiler quiet */
   16349             : }
   16350             : 
   16351             : /*
   16352             :  * dumpIndex
   16353             :  *    write out to fout a user-defined index
   16354             :  */
   16355             : static void
   16356           0 : dumpIndex(Archive *fout, IndxInfo *indxinfo)
   16357             : {
   16358           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   16359           0 :     TableInfo  *tbinfo = indxinfo->indextable;
   16360           0 :     bool        is_constraint = (indxinfo->indexconstraint != 0);
   16361             :     PQExpBuffer q;
   16362             :     PQExpBuffer delq;
   16363             :     char       *qindxname;
   16364             : 
   16365           0 :     if (dopt->dataOnly)
   16366           0 :         return;
   16367             : 
   16368           0 :     q = createPQExpBuffer();
   16369           0 :     delq = createPQExpBuffer();
   16370             : 
   16371           0 :     qindxname = pg_strdup(fmtId(indxinfo->dobj.name));
   16372             : 
   16373             :     /*
   16374             :      * If there's an associated constraint, don't dump the index per se, but
   16375             :      * do dump any comment for it.  (This is safe because dependency ordering
   16376             :      * will have ensured the constraint is emitted first.)  Note that the
   16377             :      * emitted comment has to be shown as depending on the constraint, not the
   16378             :      * index, in such cases.
   16379             :      */
   16380           0 :     if (!is_constraint)
   16381             :     {
   16382           0 :         char       *indstatcols = indxinfo->indstatcols;
   16383           0 :         char       *indstatvals = indxinfo->indstatvals;
   16384           0 :         char      **indstatcolsarray = NULL;
   16385           0 :         char      **indstatvalsarray = NULL;
   16386             :         int         nstatcols;
   16387             :         int         nstatvals;
   16388             : 
   16389           0 :         if (dopt->binary_upgrade)
   16390           0 :             binary_upgrade_set_pg_class_oids(fout, q,
   16391             :                                              indxinfo->dobj.catId.oid, true);
   16392             : 
   16393             :         /* Plain secondary index */
   16394           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(q, "%s;\n", indxinfo->indexdef);
   16395             : 
   16396             :         /*
   16397             :          * Append ALTER TABLE commands as needed to set properties that we
   16398             :          * only have ALTER TABLE syntax for.  Keep this in sync with the
   16399             :          * similar code in dumpConstraint!
   16400             :          */
   16401             : 
   16402             :         /* If the index is clustered, we need to record that. */
   16403           0 :         if (indxinfo->indisclustered)
   16404             :         {
   16405           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(q, "\nALTER TABLE %s CLUSTER",
   16406           0 :                               fmtQualifiedDumpable(tbinfo));
   16407             :             /* index name is not qualified in this syntax */
   16408           0 :             appendPQExpBuffer(q, " ON %s;\n",
   16409             :                               qindxname);
   16410             :         }
   16411             : 
   16412             :         /*
   16413             :          * If the index has any statistics on some of its columns, generate
   16414             :          * the associated ALTER INDEX queries.
   16415             :          */
   16416           0 :         if (parsePGArray(indstatcols, &indstatcolsarray, &nstatcols) &&
   16417           0 :             parsePGArray(indstatvals, &indstatvalsarray, &nstatvals) &&
   16418           0 :             nstatcols == nstatvals)
   16419             :         {
   16420             :             int         j;
   16421             :

   16884             : 
   16885             : /*
   16886             :  * findLastBuiltinOid_V71 -
   16887             :  *
   16888             :  * find the last built in oid
   16889             :  *
   16890             :  * For 7.1 through 8.0, we do this by retrieving datlastsysoid from the
   16891             :  * pg_database entry for the current database.  (Note: current_database()
   16892             :  * requires 7.3; pg_dump requires 8.0 now.)
   16893             :  */
   16894             : static Oid
   16895           0 : findLastBuiltinOid_V71(Archive *fout)
   16896             : {
   16897             :     PGresult   *res;
   16898             :     Oid         last_oid;
   16899             : 
   16900           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQueryForSingleRow(fout,

   16905           0 :     return last_oid;

   16907             : 
   16908             : /*
   16909             :  * dumpSequence
   16910             :  *    write the declaration (not data) of one user-defined sequence
   16911             :  */
   16912             : static void
   16913           0 : dumpSequence(Archive *fout, TableInfo *tbinfo)
   16914             : {
   16915           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   16916             :     PGresult   *res;

   16932             : 
   16933           0 :     qseqname = pg_strdup(fmtId(tbinfo->dobj.name));
   16934             : 
   16935           0 :     if (fout->remoteVersion >= 100000)
   16936             :     {
   16937           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query,
   16938             :                           "SELECT format_type(seqtypid, NULL), "

   16946           0 :     else if (fout->remoteVersion >= 80400)
   16947             :     {

   16987             : 
   16988             :     /* Calculate default limits for a sequence of this type */
   16989           0 :     is_ascending = (incby[0] != '-');
   16990           0 :     if (strcmp(seqtype, "smallint") == 0)
   16991             :     {
   16992           0 :         default_minv = is_ascending ? 1 : PG_INT16_MIN;
   16993           0 :         default_maxv = is_ascending ? PG_INT16_MAX : -1;
   16994             :     }
   16995           0 :     else if (strcmp(seqtype, "integer") == 0)
   16996             :     {

   16998           0 :         default_maxv = is_ascending ? PG_INT32_MAX : -1;
   16999             :     }
   17000           0 :     else if (strcmp(seqtype, "bigint") == 0)
   17001             :     {
   17002           0 :         default_minv = is_ascending ? 1 : PG_INT64_MIN;
   17003           0 :         default_maxv = is_ascending ? PG_INT64_MAX : -1;
   17004             :     }
   17005             :     else
   17006             :     {
   17007           0 :         fatal("unrecognized sequence type: %s", seqtype);

   17009             :     }
   17010             : 
   17011             :     /*
   17012             :      * 64-bit strtol() isn't very portable, so convert the limits to strings

   17018             :     /* Don't print minv/maxv if they match the respective default limit */

   17111             :     /*
   17112             :      * If the sequence is owned by a table column, emit the ALTER for it as a
   17113             :      * separate TOC entry immediately following the sequence's own entry. It's
   17114             :      * OK to do this rather than using full sorting logic, because the
   17115             :      * dependency that tells us it's owned will have forced the table to be
   17116             :      * created first.  We can't just include the ALTER in the TOC entry
   17117             :      * because it will fail if we haven't reassigned the sequence owner to
   17118             :      * match the table's owner.
   17119             :      *
   17120             :      * We need not schema-qualify the table reference because both sequence
   17121             :      * and table must be in the same schema.
   17122             :      */

   17225             : /*
   17226             :  * dumpTrigger
   17227             :  *    write the declaration of one user-defined table trigger
   17228             :  */
   17229             : static void
   17230           0 : dumpTrigger(Archive *fout, TriggerInfo *tginfo)
   17231             : {
   17232           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   17233           0 :     TableInfo  *tbinfo = tginfo->tgtable;
   17234             :     PQExpBuffer query;
   17235             :     PQExpBuffer delqry;
   17236             :     PQExpBuffer trigprefix;

   17238             :     char       *tgargs;
   17239             :     size_t      lentgargs;
   17240             :     const char *p;
   17241             :     int         findx;
   17242             :     char       *tag;
   17243             : 
   17244             :     /*
   17245             :      * we needn't check dobj.dump because TriggerInfo wouldn't have been
   17246             :      * created in the first place for non-dumpable triggers
   17247             :      */
   17248           0 :     if (dopt->dataOnly)
   17249           0 :         return;
   17250             : 
   17251           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   17252           0 :     delqry = createPQExpBuffer();
   17253           0 :     trigprefix = createPQExpBuffer();
   17254             : 
   17255           0 :     qtabname = pg_strdup(fmtId(tbinfo->dobj.name));
   17256             : 
   17257           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(delqry, "DROP TRIGGER %s ",
   17258           0 :                       fmtId(tginfo->dobj.name));
   17259           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(delqry, "ON %s;\n",
   17260           0 :                       fmtQualifiedDumpable(tbinfo));
   17261             : 
   17262           0 :     if (tginfo->tgdef)
   17263             :     {
   17264           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "%s;\n", tginfo->tgdef);
   17265             :     }
   17266             :     else
   17267             :     {
   17268           0 :         if (tginfo->tgisconstraint)
   17269             :         {
   17270           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "CREATE CONSTRAINT TRIGGER ");
   17271           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(query, fmtId(tginfo->tgconstrname));
   17272             :         }
   17273             :         else
   17274             :         {
   17275           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "CREATE TRIGGER ");
   17276           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(query, fmtId(tginfo->dobj.name));
   17277             :         }
   17278           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "\n    ");
   17279             : 
   17280             :         /* Trigger type */
   17281           0 :         if (TRIGGER_FOR_BEFORE(tginfo->tgtype))
   17282           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "BEFORE");
   17283           0 :         else if (TRIGGER_FOR_AFTER(tginfo->tgtype))
   17284           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "AFTER");
   17285           0 :         else if (TRIGGER_FOR_INSTEAD(tginfo->tgtype))
   17286           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "INSTEAD OF");
   17287             :         else
   17288             :         {
   17289           0 :             pg_log_error("unexpected tgtype value: %d", tginfo->tgtype);
   17290           0 :             exit_nicely(1);
   17291             :         }
   17292             : 
   17293           0 :         findx = 0;
   17294           0 :         if (TRIGGER_FOR_INSERT(tginfo->tgtype))
   17295             :         {
   17296           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(query, " INSERT");
   17297           0 :             findx++;
   17298             :         }
   17299           0 :         if (TRIGGER_FOR_DELETE(tginfo->tgtype))
   17300             :         {
   17301           0 :             if (findx > 0)
   17302           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, " OR DELETE");

   17304           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, " DELETE");
   17305           0 :             findx++;
   17306             :         }
   17307           0 :         if (TRIGGER_FOR_UPDATE(tginfo->tgtype))
   17308             :         {
   17309           0 :             if (findx > 0)
   17310           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, " OR UPDATE");
   17311             :             else
   17312           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, " UPDATE");
   17313           0 :             findx++;
   17314             :         }
   17315           0 :         if (TRIGGER_FOR_TRUNCATE(tginfo->tgtype))
   17316             :         {
   17317           0 :             if (findx > 0)
   17318           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, " OR TRUNCATE");
   17319             :             else
   17320           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, " TRUNCATE");
   17321           0 :             findx++;
   17322             :         }
   17323           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, " ON %s\n",
   17324           0 :                           fmtQualifiedDumpable(tbinfo));
   17325             : 
   17326           0 :         if (tginfo->tgisconstraint)
   17327             :         {
   17328           0 :             if (OidIsValid(tginfo->tgconstrrelid))
   17329             :             {
   17330             :                 /* regclass output is already quoted */
   17331           0 :                 appendPQExpBuffer(query, "    FROM %s\n    ",
   17332             :                                   tginfo->tgconstrrelname);
   17333             :             }
   17334           0 :             if (!tginfo->tgdeferrable)
   17335           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "NOT ");

   17338           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "DEFERRED\n");
   17339             :             else
   17340           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "IMMEDIATE\n");
   17341             :         }
   17342             : 
   17343           0 :         if (TRIGGER_FOR_ROW(tginfo->tgtype))
   17344           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "    FOR EACH ROW\n    ");
   17345             :         else
   17346           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "    FOR EACH STATEMENT\n    ");
   17347             : 
   17348             :         /* regproc output is already sufficiently quoted */
   17349           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "EXECUTE FUNCTION %s(",
   17350             :                           tginfo->tgfname);
   17351             : 
   17352           0 :         tgargs = (char *) PQunescapeBytea((unsigned char *) tginfo->tgargs,
   17353             :                                           &lentgargs);
   17354           0 :         p = tgargs;
   17355           0 :         for (findx = 0; findx < tginfo->tgnargs; findx++)
   17356             :         {
   17357             :             /* find the embedded null that terminates this trigger argument */
   17358           0 :             size_t      tlen = strlen(p);
   17359             : 
   17360           0 :             if (p + tlen >= tgargs + lentgargs)
   17361             :             {
   17362             :                 /* hm, not found before end of bytea value... */
   17363           0 :                 pg_log_error("invalid argument string (%s) for trigger \"%s\" on table \"%s\"",
   17364             :                              tginfo->tgargs,
   17365             :                              tginfo->dobj.name,
   17366             :                              tbinfo->dobj.name);
   17367           0 :                 exit_nicely(1);
   17368             :             }
   17369             : 
   17370           0 :             if (findx > 0)
   17371           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, ", ");
   17372           0 :             appendStringLiteralAH(query, p, fout);
   17373           0 :             p += tlen + 1;
   17374             :         }
   17375           0 :         free(tgargs);
   17376           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(query, ");\n");
   17377             :     }
   17378             : 
   17379           0 :     if (tginfo->tgenabled != 't' && tginfo->tgenabled != 'O')
   17380             :     {
   17381           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, "\nALTER TABLE %s ",
   17382           0 :                           fmtQualifiedDumpable(tbinfo));
   17383           0 :         switch (tginfo->tgenabled)
   17384             :         {
   17385             :             case 'D':
   17386             :             case 'f':
   17387           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "DISABLE");
   17388           0 :                 break;
   17389             :             case 'A':
   17390           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "ENABLE ALWAYS");
   17391           0 :                 break;
   17392             :             case 'R':
   17393           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "ENABLE REPLICA");
   17394           0 :                 break;
   17395             :             default:
   17396           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "ENABLE");
   17397           0 :                 break;
   17398             :         }
   17399           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(query, " TRIGGER %s;\n",
   17400           0 :                           fmtId(tginfo->dobj.name));
   17401             :     }
   17402             : 
   17403           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(trigprefix, "TRIGGER %s ON",
   17404           0 :                       fmtId(tginfo->dobj.name));
   17405             : 
   17406           0 :     tag = psprintf("%s %s", tbinfo->dobj.name, tginfo->dobj.name);
   17407             :

   17409           0 :         ArchiveEntry(fout, tginfo->dobj.catId, tginfo->dobj.dumpId,

   17436             : {

   17442             :     /* Skip if not to be dumped */

   17444           0 :         return;
   17445             : 
   17446           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   17447           0 :     delqry = createPQExpBuffer();

   17450             :

   17470             :                           qevtname);

   17475           0 :                 break;

   17478           0 :                 break;
   17479             :             case 'R':
   17480           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "ENABLE REPLICA");
   17481           0 :                 break;

   17483           0 :                 appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "ENABLE");
   17484           0 :                 break;

   17486           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(query, ";\n");

   17510           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   17511           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(delqry);

   17513             : }

   17515             : /*
   17516             :  * dumpRule
   17517             :  *      Dump a rule
   17518             :  */

   17520           0 : dumpRule(Archive *fout, RuleInfo *rinfo)
   17521             : {

   17533             :     /* Skip if not to be dumped */

   17539             :      * we do not want to dump it as a separate object.

   17542           0 :         return;

   17546             :      * instead of a rule.

   17559             :         PQExpBuffer result;
   17560             :

   17562             :          * We need OR REPLACE here because we'll be replacing a dummy view.
   17563             :          * Otherwise this should look largely like the regular view dump code.

   17599           0 :         PQclear(res);
   17600             :     }
   17601             : 
   17602             :     /*

   17604             :      * differs from the default.
   17605             :      */
   17606           0 :     if (rinfo->ev_enabled != 'O')
   17607             :     {
   17608           0 :         appendPQExpBuffer(cmd, "ALTER TABLE %s ", fmtQualifiedDumpable(tbinfo));

   17610             :         {

   17618           0 :                 break;

   17620           0 :                 appendPQExpBuffer(cmd, "DISABLE RULE %s;\n",
   17621           0 :                                   fmtId(rinfo->dobj.name));
   17622           0 :                 break;
   17623             :         }
   17624             :     }
   17625             : 
   17626           0 :     if (is_view)
   17627             :     {
   17628             :         /*
   17629             :          * We can't DROP a view's ON SELECT rule.  Instead, use CREATE OR
   17630             :          * REPLACE VIEW to replace the rule with something with minimal

   17673           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(cmd);
