   17677             : }
   17678             : 
   17679             : /*
   17680             :  * getExtensionMembership --- obtain extension membership data
   17681             :  *
   17682             :  * We need to identify objects that are extension members as soon as they're
   17683             :  * loaded, so that we can correctly determine whether they need to be dumped.
   17684             :  * Generally speaking, extension member objects will get marked as *not* to
   17685             :  * be dumped, as they will be recreated by the single CREATE EXTENSION
   17686             :  * command.  However, in binary upgrade mode we still need to dump the members
   17687             :  * individually.
   17688             :  */
   17689             : void
   17690           0 : getExtensionMembership(Archive *fout, ExtensionInfo extinfo[],
   17691             :                        int numExtensions)
   17692             : {
   17693             :     PQExpBuffer query;
   17694             :     PGresult   *res;
   17695             :     int         ntups,
   17696             :                 nextmembers,
   17697             :                 i;
   17698             :     int         i_classid,
   17699             :                 i_objid,
   17700             :                 i_refobjid;
   17701             :     ExtensionMemberId *extmembers;
   17702             :     ExtensionInfo *ext;
   17703             : 
   17704             :     /* Nothing to do if no extensions */
   17705           0 :     if (numExtensions == 0)
   17706           0 :         return;
   17707             : 
   17708           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   17709             : 
   17710             :     /* refclassid constraint is redundant but may speed the search */
   17711           0 :     appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "SELECT "
   17712             :                          "classid, objid, refobjid "
   17713             :                          "FROM pg_depend "
   17714             :                          "WHERE refclassid = 'pg_extension'::regclass "
   17715             :                          "AND deptype = 'e' "
   17716             :                          "ORDER BY 3");
   17717             : 
   17718           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQuery(fout, query->data, PGRES_TUPLES_OK);
   17719             : 
   17720           0 :     ntups = PQntuples(res);
   17721             : 
   17722           0 :     i_classid = PQfnumber(res, "classid");
   17723           0 :     i_objid = PQfnumber(res, "objid");
   17724           0 :     i_refobjid = PQfnumber(res, "refobjid");
   17725             : 
   17726           0 :     extmembers = (ExtensionMemberId *) pg_malloc(ntups * sizeof(ExtensionMemberId));
   17727           0 :     nextmembers = 0;
   17728             : 
   17729             :     /*
   17730             :      * Accumulate data into extmembers[].
   17731             :      *
   17732             :      * Since we ordered the SELECT by referenced ID, we can expect that
   17733             :      * multiple entries for the same extension will appear together; this
   17734             :      * saves on searches.
   17735             :      */
   17736           0 :     ext = NULL;
   17737             : 
   17738           0 :     for (i = 0; i < ntups; i++)
   17739             :     {
   17740             :         CatalogId   objId;
   17741             :         Oid         extId;
   17742             : 
   17743           0 :         objId.tableoid = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_classid));
   17744           0 :         objId.oid = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_objid));
   17745           0 :         extId = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_refobjid));
   17746             : 
   17747           0 :         if (ext == NULL ||
   17748           0 :             ext->dobj.catId.oid != extId)
   17749           0 :             ext = findExtensionByOid(extId);
   17750             : 
   17751           0 :         if (ext == NULL)
   17752             :         {
   17753             :             /* shouldn't happen */
   17754           0 :             pg_log_warning("could not find referenced extension %u", extId);
   17755           0 :             continue;
   17756             :         }
   17757             : 
   17758           0 :         extmembers[nextmembers].catId = objId;
   17759           0 :         extmembers[nextmembers].ext = ext;
   17760           0 :         nextmembers++;
   17761             :     }
   17762             : 
   17763           0 :     PQclear(res);
   17764             : 
   17765             :     /* Remember the data for use later */
   17766           0 :     setExtensionMembership(extmembers, nextmembers);
   17767             : 
   17768           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   17769             : }
   17770             : 
   17771             : /*
   17772             :  * processExtensionTables --- deal with extension configuration tables
   17773             :  *
   17774             :  * There are two parts to this process:
   17775             :  *
   17776             :  * 1. Identify and create dump records for extension configuration tables.
   17777             :  *
   17778             :  *    Extensions can mark tables as "configuration", which means that the user
   17779             :  *    is able and expected to modify those tables after the extension has been
   17780             :  *    loaded.  For these tables, we dump out only the data- the structure is
   17781             :  *    expected to be handled at CREATE EXTENSION time, including any indexes or
   17782             :  *    foreign keys, which brings us to-
   17783             :  *
   17784             :  * 2. Record FK dependencies between configuration tables.
   17785             :  *
   17786             :  *    Due to the FKs being created at CREATE EXTENSION time and therefore before
   17787             :  *    the data is loaded, we have to work out what the best order for reloading
   17788             :  *    the data is, to avoid FK violations when the tables are restored.  This is
   17789             :  *    not perfect- we can't handle circular dependencies and if any exist they
   17790             :  *    will cause an invalid dump to be produced (though at least all of the data
   17791             :  *    is included for a user to manually restore).  This is currently documented
   17792             :  *    but perhaps we can provide a better solution in the future.
   17793             :  */
   17794             : void
   17795           0 : processExtensionTables(Archive *fout, ExtensionInfo extinfo[],
   17796             :                        int numExtensions)
   17797             : {
   17798           0 :     DumpOptions *dopt = fout->dopt;
   17799             :     PQExpBuffer query;
   17800             :     PGresult   *res;
   17801             :     int         ntups,
   17802             :                 i;
   17803             :     int         i_conrelid,
   17804             :                 i_confrelid;
   17805             : 
   17806             :     /* Nothing to do if no extensions */
   17807           0 :     if (numExtensions == 0)
   17808           0 :         return;
   17809             : 
   17810             :     /*
   17811             :      * Identify extension configuration tables and create TableDataInfo
   17812             :      * objects for them, ensuring their data will be dumped even though the
   17813             :      * tables themselves won't be.
   17814             :      *
   17815             :      * Note that we create TableDataInfo objects even in schemaOnly mode, ie,
   17816             :      * user data in a configuration table is treated like schema data. This
   17817             :      * seems appropriate since system data in a config table would get
   17818             :      * reloaded by CREATE EXTENSION.
   17819             :      */
   17820           0 :     for (i = 0; i < numExtensions; i++)
   17821             :     {
   17822           0 :         ExtensionInfo *curext = &(extinfo[i]);
   17823           0 :         char       *extconfig = curext->extconfig;
   17824           0 :         char       *extcondition = curext->extcondition;
   17825           0 :         char      **extconfigarray = NULL;
   17826           0 :         char      **extconditionarray = NULL;
   17827             :         int         nconfigitems;
   17828             :         int         nconditionitems;
   17829             : 
   17830           0 :         if (parsePGArray(extconfig, &extconfigarray, &nconfigitems) &&
   17831           0 :             parsePGArray(extcondition, &extconditionarray, &nconditionitems) &&
   17832           0 :             nconfigitems == nconditionitems)
   17833             :         {
   17834             :             int         j;
   17835             : 
   17836           0 :             for (j = 0; j < nconfigitems; j++)
   17837             :             {
   17838             :                 TableInfo  *configtbl;
   17839           0 :                 Oid         configtbloid = atooid(extconfigarray[j]);
   17840           0 :                 bool        dumpobj =
   17841           0 :                 curext->dobj.dump & DUMP_COMPONENT_DEFINITION;
   17842             : 
   17843           0 :                 configtbl = findTableByOid(configtbloid);
   17844           0 :                 if (configtbl == NULL)
   17845           0 :                     continue;
   17846             : 
   17847             :                 /*
   17848             :                  * Tables of not-to-be-dumped extensions shouldn't be dumped
   17849             :                  * unless the table or its schema is explicitly included
   17850             :                  */
   17851           0 :                 if (!(curext->dobj.dump & DUMP_COMPONENT_DEFINITION))
   17852             :                 {
   17853             :                     /* check table explicitly requested */
   17854           0 :                     if (table_include_oids.head != NULL &&
   17855           0 :                         simple_oid_list_member(&table_include_oids,
   17856             :                                                configtbloid))
   17857           0 :                         dumpobj = true;
   17858             : 
   17859             :                     /* check table's schema explicitly requested */
   17860           0 :                     if (configtbl->dobj.namespace->dobj.dump &
   17861             :                         DUMP_COMPONENT_DATA)
   17862           0 :                         dumpobj = true;
   17863             :                 }
   17864             : 
   17865             :                 /* check table excluded by an exclusion switch */
   17866           0 :                 if (table_exclude_oids.head != NULL &&
   17867           0 :                     simple_oid_list_member(&table_exclude_oids,
   17868             :                                            configtbloid))
   17869           0 :                     dumpobj = false;
   17870             : 
   17871             :                 /* check schema excluded by an exclusion switch */
   17872           0 :                 if (simple_oid_list_member(&schema_exclude_oids,
   17873           0 :                                            configtbl->dobj.namespace->dobj.catId.oid))
   17874           0 :                     dumpobj = false;
   17875             : 
   17876           0 :                 if (dumpobj)
   17877             :                 {
   17878           0 :                     makeTableDataInfo(dopt, configtbl);
   17879           0 :                     if (configtbl->dataObj != NULL)
   17880             :                     {
   17881           0 :                         if (strlen(extconditionarray[j]) > 0)
   17882           0 :                             configtbl->dataObj->filtercond = pg_strdup(extconditionarray[j]);
   17883             :                     }
   17884             :                 }
   17885             :             }
   17886             :         }
   17887           0 :         if (extconfigarray)
   17888           0 :             free(extconfigarray);
   17889           0 :         if (extconditionarray)
   17890           0 :             free(extconditionarray);
   17891             :     }
   17892             : 
   17893             :     /*
   17894             :      * Now that all the TableDataInfo objects have been created for all the
   17895             :      * extensions, check their FK dependencies and register them to try and
   17896             :      * dump the data out in an order that they can be restored in.
   17897             :      *
   17898             :      * Note that this is not a problem for user tables as their FKs are
   17899             :      * recreated after the data has been loaded.
   17900             :      */
   17901             : 
   17902           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   17903             : 
   17904           0 :     printfPQExpBuffer(query,
   17905             :                       "SELECT conrelid, confrelid "
   17906             :                       "FROM pg_constraint "
   17907             :                       "JOIN pg_depend ON (objid = confrelid) "
   17908             :                       "WHERE contype = 'f' "
   17909             :                       "AND refclassid = 'pg_extension'::regclass "
   17910             :                       "AND classid = 'pg_class'::regclass;");
   17911             : 
   17912           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQuery(fout, query->data, PGRES_TUPLES_OK);
   17913           0 :     ntups = PQntuples(res);
   17914             : 
   17915           0 :     i_conrelid = PQfnumber(res, "conrelid");
   17916           0 :     i_confrelid = PQfnumber(res, "confrelid");
   17917             : 
   17918             :     /* Now get the dependencies and register them */
   17919           0 :     for (i = 0; i < ntups; i++)
   17920             :     {
   17921             :         Oid         conrelid,
   17922             :                     confrelid;
   17923             :         TableInfo  *reftable,
   17924             :                    *contable;

   17926           0 :         conrelid = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_conrelid));
   17927           0 :         confrelid = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_confrelid));
   17928           0 :         contable = findTableByOid(conrelid);
   17929           0 :         reftable = findTableByOid(confrelid);
   17930             : 
   17931           0 :         if (reftable == NULL ||
   17932           0 :             reftable->dataObj == NULL ||
   17933           0 :             contable == NULL ||
   17934           0 :             contable->dataObj == NULL)
   17935           0 :             continue;
   17936             : 
   17937             :         /*
   17938             :          * Make referencing TABLE_DATA object depend on the referenced table's
   17939             :          * TABLE_DATA object.
   17940             :          */
   17941           0 :         addObjectDependency(&contable->dataObj->dobj,
   17942           0 :                             reftable->dataObj->dobj.dumpId);
   17943             :     }
   17944           0 :     PQclear(res);
   17945           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   17946             : }
   17947             : 
   17948             : /*
   17949             :  * getDependencies --- obtain available dependency data
   17950             :  */
   17951             : static void
   17952           0 : getDependencies(Archive *fout)
   17953             : {
   17954             :     PQExpBuffer query;
   17955             :     PGresult   *res;
   17956             :     int         ntups,
   17957             :                 i;
   17958             :     int         i_classid,
   17959             :                 i_objid,
   17960             :                 i_refclassid,
   17961             :                 i_refobjid,
   17962             :                 i_deptype;
   17963             :     DumpableObject *dobj,
   17964             :                *refdobj;
   17965             : 
   17966           0 :     pg_log_info("reading dependency data");
   17967             : 
   17968           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   17969             : 
   17970             :     /*
   17971             :      * Messy query to collect the dependency data we need.  Note that we
   17972             :      * ignore the sub-object column, so that dependencies of or on a column
   17973             :      * look the same as dependencies of or on a whole table.
   17974             :      *
   17975             :      * PIN dependencies aren't interesting, and EXTENSION dependencies were
   17976             :      * already processed by getExtensionMembership.
   17977             :      */
   17978           0 :     appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "SELECT "
   17979             :                          "classid, objid, refclassid, refobjid, deptype "
   17980             :                          "FROM pg_depend "
   17981             :                          "WHERE deptype != 'p' AND deptype != 'e'\n");
   17982             : 
   17983             :     /*
   17984             :      * Since we don't treat pg_amop entries as separate DumpableObjects, we
   17985             :      * have to translate their dependencies into dependencies of their parent
   17986             :      * opfamily.  Ignore internal dependencies though, as those will point to
   17987             :      * their parent opclass, which we needn't consider here (and if we did,
   17988             :      * it'd just result in circular dependencies).  Also, "loose" opfamily
   17989             :      * entries will have dependencies on their parent opfamily, which we
   17990             :      * should drop since they'd likewise become useless self-dependencies.
   17991             :      * (But be sure to keep deps on *other* opfamilies; see amopsortfamily.)
   17992             :      *
   17993             :      * Skip this for pre-8.3 source servers: pg_opfamily doesn't exist there,
   17994             :      * and the (known) cases where it would matter to have these dependencies
   17995             :      * can't arise anyway.
   17996             :      */
   17997           0 :     if (fout->remoteVersion >= 80300)
   17998             :     {
   17999           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "UNION ALL\n"
   18000             :                              "SELECT 'pg_opfamily'::regclass AS classid, amopfamily AS objid, refclassid, refobjid, deptype "
   18001             :                              "FROM pg_depend d, pg_amop o "
   18002             :                              "WHERE deptype NOT IN ('p', 'e', 'i') AND "
   18003             :                              "classid = 'pg_amop'::regclass AND objid = o.oid "
   18004             :                              "AND NOT (refclassid = 'pg_opfamily'::regclass AND amopfamily = refobjid)\n");
   18005             : 
   18006             :         /* Likewise for pg_amproc entries */
   18007           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "UNION ALL\n"
   18008             :                              "SELECT 'pg_opfamily'::regclass AS classid, amprocfamily AS objid, refclassid, refobjid, deptype "
   18009             :                              "FROM pg_depend d, pg_amproc p "
   18010             :                              "WHERE deptype NOT IN ('p', 'e', 'i') AND "
   18011             :                              "classid = 'pg_amproc'::regclass AND objid = p.oid "
   18012             :                              "AND NOT (refclassid = 'pg_opfamily'::regclass AND amprocfamily = refobjid)\n");
   18013             :     }
   18014             : 
   18015             :     /* Sort the output for efficiency below */
   18016           0 :     appendPQExpBufferStr(query, "ORDER BY 1,2");
   18017             : 
   18018           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQuery(fout, query->data, PGRES_TUPLES_OK);
   18019             : 
   18020           0 :     ntups = PQntuples(res);
   18021             : 
   18022           0 :     i_classid = PQfnumber(res, "classid");
   18023           0 :     i_objid = PQfnumber(res, "objid");
   18024           0 :     i_refclassid = PQfnumber(res, "refclassid");
   18025           0 :     i_refobjid = PQfnumber(res, "refobjid");
   18026           0 :     i_deptype = PQfnumber(res, "deptype");
   18027             : 
   18028             :     /*
   18029             :      * Since we ordered the SELECT by referencing ID, we can expect that
   18030             :      * multiple entries for the same object will appear together; this saves
   18031             :      * on searches.
   18032             :      */
   18033           0 :     dobj = NULL;
   18034             : 
   18035           0 :     for (i = 0; i < ntups; i++)
   18036             :     {
   18037             :         CatalogId   objId;
   18038             :         CatalogId   refobjId;
   18039             :         char        deptype;
   18040             : 
   18041           0 :         objId.tableoid = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_classid));
   18042           0 :         objId.oid = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_objid));
   18043           0 :         refobjId.tableoid = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_refclassid));
   18044           0 :         refobjId.oid = atooid(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_refobjid));
   18045           0 :         deptype = *(PQgetvalue(res, i, i_deptype));
   18046             : 
   18047           0 :         if (dobj == NULL ||
   18048           0 :             dobj->catId.tableoid != objId.tableoid ||
   18049           0 :             dobj->catId.oid != objId.oid)
   18050           0 :             dobj = findObjectByCatalogId(objId);
   18051             : 
   18052             :         /*
   18053             :          * Failure to find objects mentioned in pg_depend is not unexpected,
   18054             :          * since for example we don't collect info about TOAST tables.
   18055             :          */
   18056           0 :         if (dobj == NULL)
   18057             :         {
   18058             : #ifdef NOT_USED
   18059             :             pg_log_warning("no referencing object %u %u",
   18060             :                            objId.tableoid, objId.oid);
   18061             : #endif
   18062           0 :             continue;
   18063             :         }
   18064             : 
   18065           0 :         refdobj = findObjectByCatalogId(refobjId);
   18066             : 
   18067           0 :         if (refdobj == NULL)
   18068             :         {
   18069             : #ifdef NOT_USED
   18070             :             pg_log_warning("no referenced object %u %u",
   18071             :                            refobjId.tableoid, refobjId.oid);
   18072             : #endif
   18073           0 :             continue;
   18074             :         }
   18075             : 
   18076             :         /*
   18077             :          * Ordinarily, table rowtypes have implicit dependencies on their
   18078             :          * tables.  However, for a composite type the implicit dependency goes
   18079             :          * the other way in pg_depend; which is the right thing for DROP but
   18080             :          * it doesn't produce the dependency ordering we need. So in that one
   18081             :          * case, we reverse the direction of the dependency.
   18082             :          */
   18083           0 :         if (deptype == 'i' &&
   18084           0 :             dobj->objType == DO_TABLE &&
   18085           0 :             refdobj->objType == DO_TYPE)
   18086           0 :             addObjectDependency(refdobj, dobj->dumpId);
   18087             :         else
   18088             :             /* normal case */
   18089           0 :             addObjectDependency(dobj, refdobj->dumpId);
   18090             :     }
   18091             : 
   18092           0 :     PQclear(res);
   18093             : 
   18094           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   18095           0 : }
   18096             : 
   18097             : 
   18098             : /*
   18099             :  * createBoundaryObjects - create dummy DumpableObjects to represent
   18100             :  * dump section boundaries.
   18101             :  */
   18102             : static DumpableObject *
   18103           0 : createBoundaryObjects(void)
   18104             : {
   18105             :     DumpableObject *dobjs;
   18106             : 
   18107           0 :     dobjs = (DumpableObject *) pg_malloc(2 * sizeof(DumpableObject));
   18108             : 
   18109           0 :     dobjs[0].objType = DO_PRE_DATA_BOUNDARY;
   18110           0 :     dobjs[0].catId = nilCatalogId;
   18111           0 :     AssignDumpId(dobjs + 0);
   18112           0 :     dobjs[0].name = pg_strdup("PRE-DATA BOUNDARY");
   18113             : 
   18114           0 :     dobjs[1].objType = DO_POST_DATA_BOUNDARY;
   18115           0 :     dobjs[1].catId = nilCatalogId;
   18116           0 :     AssignDumpId(dobjs + 1);
   18117           0 :     dobjs[1].name = pg_strdup("POST-DATA BOUNDARY");
   18118             : 
   18119           0 :     return dobjs;
   18120             : }
   18121             : 
   18122             : /*
   18123             :  * addBoundaryDependencies - add dependencies as needed to enforce the dump
   18124             :  * section boundaries.
   18125             :  */
   18126             : static void
   18127           0 : addBoundaryDependencies(DumpableObject **dobjs, int numObjs,
   18128             :                         DumpableObject *boundaryObjs)
   18129             : {
   18130           0 :     DumpableObject *preDataBound = boundaryObjs + 0;
   18131           0 :     DumpableObject *postDataBound = boundaryObjs + 1;
   18132             :     int         i;
   18133             : 
   18134           0 :     for (i = 0; i < numObjs; i++)
   18135             :     {
   18136           0 :         DumpableObject *dobj = dobjs[i];
   18137             : 
   18138             :         /*
   18139             :          * The classification of object types here must match the SECTION_xxx
   18140             :          * values assigned during subsequent ArchiveEntry calls!
   18141             :          */
   18142           0 :         switch (dobj->objType)
   18143             :         {
   18144             :             case DO_NAMESPACE:
   18145             :             case DO_EXTENSION:
   18146             :             case DO_TYPE:
   18147             :             case DO_SHELL_TYPE:
   18148             :             case DO_FUNC:
   18149             :             case DO_AGG:
   18150             :             case DO_OPERATOR:
   18151             :             case DO_ACCESS_METHOD:
   18152             :             case DO_OPCLASS:
   18153             :             case DO_OPFAMILY:
   18154             :             case DO_COLLATION:
   18155             :             case DO_CONVERSION:
   18156             :             case DO_TABLE:
   18157             :             case DO_ATTRDEF:
   18158             :             case DO_PROCLANG:
   18159             :             case DO_CAST:
   18160             :             case DO_DUMMY_TYPE:
   18161             :             case DO_TSPARSER:
   18162             :             case DO_TSDICT:
   18163             :             case DO_TSTEMPLATE:
   18164             :             case DO_TSCONFIG:
   18165             :             case DO_FDW:
   18166             :             case DO_FOREIGN_SERVER:
   18167             :             case DO_TRANSFORM:
   18168             :             case DO_BLOB:
   18169             :                 /* Pre-data objects: must come before the pre-data boundary */
   18170           0 :                 addObjectDependency(preDataBound, dobj->dumpId);
   18171           0 :                 break;
   18172             :             case DO_TABLE_DATA:
   18173             :             case DO_SEQUENCE_SET:
   18174             :             case DO_BLOB_DATA:
   18175             :                 /* Data objects: must come between the boundaries */
   18176           0 :                 addObjectDependency(dobj, preDataBound->dumpId);
   18177           0 :                 addObjectDependency(postDataBound, dobj->dumpId);
   18178           0 :                 break;
   18179             :             case DO_INDEX:
   18180             :             case DO_INDEX_ATTACH:

   18182             :             case DO_REFRESH_MATVIEW:
   18183             :             case DO_TRIGGER:

   18187             :             case DO_PUBLICATION:
   18188             :             case DO_PUBLICATION_REL:
   18189             :             case DO_SUBSCRIPTION:
   18190             :                 /* Post-data objects: must come after the post-data boundary */
   18191           0 :                 addObjectDependency(dobj, postDataBound->dumpId);
   18192           0 :                 break;
   18193             :             case DO_RULE:
   18194             :                 /* Rules are post-data, but only if dumped separately */
   18195           0 :                 if (((RuleInfo *) dobj)->separate)
   18196           0 :                     addObjectDependency(dobj, postDataBound->dumpId);
   18197           0 :                 break;
   18198             :             case DO_CONSTRAINT:
   18199             :             case DO_FK_CONSTRAINT:
   18200             :                 /* Constraints are post-data, but only if dumped separately */
   18201           0 :                 if (((ConstraintInfo *) dobj)->separate)
   18202           0 :                     addObjectDependency(dobj, postDataBound->dumpId);
   18203           0 :                 break;
   18204             :             case DO_PRE_DATA_BOUNDARY:
   18205             :                 /* nothing to do */
   18206           0 :                 break;
   18207             :             case DO_POST_DATA_BOUNDARY:
   18208             :                 /* must come after the pre-data boundary */
   18209           0 :                 addObjectDependency(dobj, preDataBound->dumpId);
   18210           0 :                 break;
   18211             :         }
   18212             :     }
   18213           0 : }
   18214             : 
   18215             : 
   18216             : /*
   18217             :  * BuildArchiveDependencies - create dependency data for archive TOC entries
   18218             :  *
   18219             :  * The raw dependency data obtained by getDependencies() is not terribly
   18220             :  * useful in an archive dump, because in many cases there are dependency
   18221             :  * chains linking through objects that don't appear explicitly in the dump.
   18222             :  * For example, a view will depend on its _RETURN rule while the _RETURN rule
   18223             :  * will depend on other objects --- but the rule will not appear as a separate
   18224             :  * object in the dump.  We need to adjust the view's dependencies to include
   18225             :  * whatever the rule depends on that is included in the dump.
   18226             :  *
   18227             :  * Just to make things more complicated, there are also "special" dependencies
   18228             :  * such as the dependency of a TABLE DATA item on its TABLE, which we must
   18229             :  * not rearrange because pg_restore knows that TABLE DATA only depends on
   18230             :  * its table.  In these cases we must leave the dependencies strictly as-is
   18231             :  * even if they refer to not-to-be-dumped objects.
   18232             :  *
   18233             :  * To handle this, the convention is that "special" dependencies are created
   18234             :  * during ArchiveEntry calls, and an archive TOC item that has any such
   18235             :  * entries will not be touched here.  Otherwise, we recursively search the
   18236             :  * DumpableObject data structures to build the correct dependencies for each
   18237             :  * archive TOC item.
   18238             :  */
   18239             : static void
   18240           0 : BuildArchiveDependencies(Archive *fout)
   18241             : {
   18242           0 :     ArchiveHandle *AH = (ArchiveHandle *) fout;
   18243             :     TocEntry   *te;
   18244             : 
   18245             :     /* Scan all TOC entries in the archive */
   18246           0 :     for (te = AH->toc->next; te != AH->toc; te = te->next)
   18247             :     {
   18248             :         DumpableObject *dobj;
   18249             :         DumpId     *dependencies;
   18250             :         int         nDeps;
   18251             :         int         allocDeps;
   18252             : 
   18253             :         /* No need to process entries that will not be dumped */
   18254           0 :         if (te->reqs == 0)
   18255           0 :             continue;
   18256             :         /* Ignore entries that already have "special" dependencies */
   18257           0 :         if (te->nDeps > 0)
   18258           0 :             continue;
   18259             :         /* Otherwise, look up the item's original DumpableObject, if any */
   18260           0 :         dobj = findObjectByDumpId(te->dumpId);
   18261           0 :         if (dobj == NULL)
   18262           0 :             continue;
   18263             :         /* No work if it has no dependencies */
   18264           0 :         if (dobj->nDeps <= 0)
   18265           0 :             continue;
   18266             :         /* Set up work array */
   18267           0 :         allocDeps = 64;
   18268           0 :         dependencies = (DumpId *) pg_malloc(allocDeps * sizeof(DumpId));
   18269           0 :         nDeps = 0;
   18270             :         /* Recursively find all dumpable dependencies */
   18271           0 :         findDumpableDependencies(AH, dobj,
   18272             :                                  &dependencies, &nDeps, &allocDeps);
   18273             :         /* And save 'em ... */
   18274           0 :         if (nDeps > 0)
   18275             :         {
   18276           0 :             dependencies = (DumpId *) pg_realloc(dependencies,
   18277             :                                                  nDeps * sizeof(DumpId));
   18278           0 :             te->dependencies = dependencies;
   18279           0 :             te->nDeps = nDeps;
   18280             :         }
   18281             :         else
   18282           0 :             free(dependencies);
   18283             :     }
   18284           0 : }
   18285             : 
   18286             : /* Recursive search subroutine for BuildArchiveDependencies */
   18287             : static void
   18288           0 : findDumpableDependencies(ArchiveHandle *AH, DumpableObject *dobj,
   18289             :                          DumpId **dependencies, int *nDeps, int *allocDeps)
   18290             : {
   18291             :     int         i;
   18292             : 
   18293             :     /*
   18294             :      * Ignore section boundary objects: if we search through them, we'll
   18295             :      * report lots of bogus dependencies.
   18296             :      */
   18297           0 :     if (dobj->objType == DO_PRE_DATA_BOUNDARY ||
   18298           0 :         dobj->objType == DO_POST_DATA_BOUNDARY)
   18299           0 :         return;
   18300             : 
   18301           0 :     for (i = 0; i < dobj->nDeps; i++)
   18302             :     {
   18303           0 :         DumpId      depid = dobj->dependencies[i];
   18304             : 
   18305           0 :         if (TocIDRequired(AH, depid) != 0)
   18306             :         {
   18307             :             /* Object will be dumped, so just reference it as a dependency */
   18308           0 :             if (*nDeps >= *allocDeps)
   18309             :             {
   18310           0 :                 *allocDeps *= 2;
   18311           0 :                 *dependencies = (DumpId *) pg_realloc(*dependencies,
   18312           0 :                                                       *allocDeps * sizeof(DumpId));
   18313             :             }
   18314           0 :             (*dependencies)[*nDeps] = depid;
   18315           0 :             (*nDeps)++;
   18316             :         }
   18317             :         else
   18318             :         {
   18319             :             /*
   18320             :              * Object will not be dumped, so recursively consider its deps. We
   18321             :              * rely on the assumption that sortDumpableObjects already broke
   18322             :              * any dependency loops, else we might recurse infinitely.
   18323             :              */
   18324           0 :             DumpableObject *otherdobj = findObjectByDumpId(depid);
   18325             : 
   18326           0 :             if (otherdobj)
   18327           0 :                 findDumpableDependencies(AH, otherdobj,
   18328             :                                          dependencies, nDeps, allocDeps);
   18329             :         }
   18330             :     }
   18331             : }
   18332             : 
   18333             : 
   18334             : /*
   18335             :  * getFormattedTypeName - retrieve a nicely-formatted type name for the
   18336             :  * given type OID.
   18337             :  *
   18338             :  * This does not guarantee to schema-qualify the output, so it should not
   18339             :  * be used to create the target object name for CREATE or ALTER commands.
   18340             :  *
   18341             :  * TODO: there might be some value in caching the results.
   18342             :  */
   18343             : static char *
   18344           0 : getFormattedTypeName(Archive *fout, Oid oid, OidOptions opts)
   18345             : {
   18346             :     char       *result;
   18347             :     PQExpBuffer query;
   18348             :     PGresult   *res;
   18349             : 
   18350           0 :     if (oid == 0)
   18351             :     {
   18352           0 :         if ((opts & zeroAsOpaque) != 0)
   18353           0 :             return pg_strdup(g_opaque_type);
   18354           0 :         else if ((opts & zeroAsAny) != 0)
   18355           0 :             return pg_strdup("'any'");
   18356           0 :         else if ((opts & zeroAsStar) != 0)
   18357           0 :             return pg_strdup("*");
   18358           0 :         else if ((opts & zeroAsNone) != 0)
   18359           0 :             return pg_strdup("NONE");
   18360             :     }
   18361             : 
   18362           0 :     query = createPQExpBuffer();
   18363           0 :     appendPQExpBuffer(query, "SELECT pg_catalog.format_type('%u'::pg_catalog.oid, NULL)",
   18364             :                       oid);
   18365             : 
   18366           0 :     res = ExecuteSqlQueryForSingleRow(fout, query->data);
   18367             : 
   18368             :     /* result of format_type is already quoted */
   18369           0 :     result = pg_strdup(PQgetvalue(res, 0, 0));
   18370             : 
   18371           0 :     PQclear(res);
   18372           0 :     destroyPQExpBuffer(query);
   18373             : 
   18374           0 :     return result;
   18375             : }
   18376             : 
   18377             : /*
   18378             :  * Return a column list clause for the given relation.
   18379             :  *
   18380             :  * Special case: if there are no undropped columns in the relation, return
   18381             :  * "", not an invalid "()" column list.
   18382             :  */
   18383             : static const char *
   18384           0 : fmtCopyColumnList(const TableInfo *ti, PQExpBuffer buffer)
   18385             : {
   18386           0 :     int         numatts = ti->numatts;
   18387           0 :     char      **attnames = ti->attnames;
   18388           0 :     bool       *attisdropped = ti->attisdropped;
   18389           0 :     char       *attgenerated = ti->attgenerated;
   18390             :     bool        needComma;
   18391             :     int         i;
   18392             : 
   18393           0 :     appendPQExpBufferChar(buffer, '(');
   18394           0 :     needComma = false;
   18395           0 :     for (i = 0; i < numatts; i++)
   18396             :     {
   18397           0 :         if (attisdropped[i])
   18398           0 :             continue;
   18399           0 :         if (attgenerated[i])
   18400           0 :             continue;
   18401           0 :         if (needComma)
   18402           0 :             appendPQExpBufferStr(buffer, ", ");
   18403           0 :         appendPQExpBufferStr(buffer, fmtId(attnames[i]));
   18404           0 :         needComma = true;
   18405             :     }
   18406             : 
   18407           0 :     if (!needComma)
   18408           0 :         return "";                /* no undropped columns */
   18409             : 
   18410           0 :     appendPQExpBufferChar(buffer, ')');
   18411           0 :     return buffer->data;
   18412             : }
   18413             : 
   18414             : /*
   18415             :  * Check if a reloptions array is nonempty.
   18416             :  */
   18417             : static bool
   18418           0 : nonemptyReloptions(const char *reloptions)
   18419             : {
   18420             :     /* Don't want to print it if it's just "{}" */
   18421           0 :     return (reloptions != NULL && strlen(reloptions) > 2);
   18422             : }
   18423             : 
   18424             : /*
   18425             :  * Format a reloptions array and append it to the given buffer.

   18427             :  * "prefix" is prepended to the option names; typically it's "" or "toast.".
